item.title: Timor-Leste | Dili receives interministerial meeting of G7+
item.description: The capital of Timor-Leste will receive tomorrow and Saturday the sixth ministerial meeting of the G7+ that will first join the heads of the organization's diplomacy, which marks 15 years of existence. G7+ is a forum in which member countries seek to influence global discourse on peace, stability and resilience, as well as define joint actions to achieve those objectives. The Intergovernmental Organization was established on April 10, 2010, in Dili, and emerged with concern, shared by its Member States, that traditional development cooperation did not improve the situation of fragile nations. "The purpose of this meeting, the sixth G7+ministerial meeting, is to reflect on the progress achieved during the 15th anniversary of its establishment," said G7+Secretary-General, Helder da Costa. The meeting, which traditionally brings together the ministers of the finance, planning or economy of the Member States, will first join the heads of diplomacy in several countries because of “global politics”, to make a “reflection on the script for the coming years” and because G7+ has an “increasingly global voice”, said Helder da Costa. The meeting, co-organized with the Timorese Foreign Ministry, begins exactly with an intervention by Timorese Prime Minister Xanana Gusmão about “safeguarding peace in turbulent times: the vision of G7+”. The meeting will also make a presentation on the organization's path over the last 15 years and a debate on cooperation between the Member States. The G7+ has a Observer Statute to the UN General Assembly since December 2019 and in the community of Portuguese-speaking countries since July 2021. item.title: Photography | IIM with a new edition of “A Discovery of Macao and Hengqin”
item.description: The Macao International Institute (IIM) again organizes a new edition of the “Macao and Hengqin discovery” photography contest, accepting images submission until September 26. According to a press release, the initiative, organized in partnership with several local associations, aims to “reinforce the feeling of belonging and promote a concept of identity based on Macao's cultural and historical values”. In addition, the contest aims to “stimulate the knowledge of participants, especially among young people, the riches of cultural heritage, built or not, of Macao, and the traditions that enforce Macao, including attractions of the deepened cooperation zone between Guangdong and Macao in Hengqin”. The contest has two categories, intended for residents and non -residents, to “cover a vast audience”. Awards range from 500 Patacas for honorable mentions and five thousand patacas in the case of the first prize. There is also a “special award” intended for the best work presented by a partner of the Macao Digital Photography Association, worth a thousand patacas. After evaluation by the contest jury, there will be a show of the work on display scheduled for the end of this year. With this contest, the IIM “expects participants to portray aspects of Macao, with which the author culturally identifies and most estim, from historical monuments, buildings, cultural manifestations (according to the list of immaterial heritage)”. It can also be portrayed “habits, customs and beliefs, tourist events and popular, traditional and religious festivities of Chinese, Portuguese and Macaense cultures, as well as international events, as well as photography with digital creativity, as well as attractions of the deepened cooperation zone between Guangdong and Macao in Hengqin”. The contest photographs must have been taken between September 2024 and September 2025.

item.title: Maintained imprisonment for an alcoholized man who assaulted ex-girlfriend
item.description: The last court (TUI) has decided to maintain a three-year and three-month imprisonment for legal cumulation, as well as driving inhibition for a year and six months to a man who assaulted his ex-girlfriend in his car when he was under the influence of alcohol, and was also driving when he was drunk. TUI also maintained the decision to pay compensation of 1,867 million Patacas, and the insurer should support 288 thousand patacas. The case was passed on September 13, 2020, around 9:34 pm, when the man led to Macao Commercial Avenue, having parked at the door of the Fit Center Macau building, waiting for his ex-girlfriend to return home. Around 11:30 pm, the woman, when driving the car, saw that her ex-boyfriend was waiting for her and parked in the opposite ride. The woman had been the victim of assault on the part of the man during the relationship, so she stopped the car and called a friend to ask for help. It was at this moment that the attacker got out of the car, approached the ex-girlfriend's car and hit him after doing a march reversal, "causing him to block the right front door, which could not be opened." Then the man “left his vehicle and, with the key in hand, crashed violently in the glass window next to the driver of the vehicle” of the former partner, then retreated the car and beaten in the woman's car. That's when she got into her car and assaulted her, namely pressing her body, hitting her face with the key, and punched her and body punches. Tui's judgment describes that the man "suddenly bit his left forearm and fingers of his left-handed hand, then moving to the rear seat, where he pulled his hair to prevent his escape, causing his hair loss." Some people who passed the scene helped the woman escape and immobilize the man. Posttraumatic stress At the time of the incident and aggression the man had a blood alcohol rate of 1.33 grams per liter, above the legal limit. Regarding the woman, she was subject to hospital treatment. "After the expert examination, it was found that it had suffered bruises and abrasions on the scalp, various bruises and abrasions on the face, cerebral concussion, right eye bruise, traumatic cataracts in the right eye, hemorrhage in the lower right eyelid, concussion in the right eye, severe hearing impairment in the right ear," the judgment describes. In addition, aggressions have caused "the reduction of vision and asymmetry between the right and the left eye, obviously affecting its appearance and, at the same time, caused it to suffer from posttraumatic stress syndrome, which could need long-term treatment." It is also understood that the man "caused serious damage to the vehicle and damaged the Berma da Estrada Stone Floor."

item.title: Tariffs | Suppliers resort to alternative markets
item.description:
Macao has established trade agreements with Canada, Australia, Japan, and European and Southeast Asian countries that allow to minimize the effect of tariffs imposed by the White House, which came into force yesterday. The President Association of the Union of Suppliers of Macao states that from the end of May the effects will be unpredictable
The additional rate of Chinese products came yesterday, raising to 104 percent the total rate, implemented by the administration of Donald Trump, and to which Beijing also responded by raising the parade in the trade war that the White House declared to a vast range of countries and regions. For now, in the short root, the president of the Macao Suppliers Association, IP Sio Man, considers that the tariffs imposed by the United States Government (USA) will not have an impact on the supply of products and prices practiced in Macau. Speaking to the newspaper or Mun, the associative leader said that in recent years, Macau has signed commercial protocols with several countries that guarantee the diversification of imported products sources, which have resulted in the replacement of many US imported products. IP Sio Man reveals that, for example, part of the US -faced meat has been replaced by beef from Canada, Australia and New Zealand, as well as supplied by Japan and European countries. Regarding fruits, the representative points out that the large majority is bought from suppliers from the interior of China. For now, the containers who were loaded before April 5 and those already on the route to Hong Kong were only subject to a rate of 10 percent. However, IP Sio Man confessed to being difficult to predict what will happen to commercial connections with the US and prices when the load ships already arrive with charged products, something that should happen at the end of next month. Route problems The president of the Suppliers Association has an optimistic view of the commercial landscape, arguing that the countries and neighboring regions, especially from Southeast Asia, can look for low -tax markets such as Hong Kong and Macau to export their products and that this competition can lead to pricing down. In addition to Trump's fares, IP Sio Man stressed the instability that has severely cut off maritime transport in the Red Sea, due to Israel and US offensive in Yemen and the attacks of the Huti rebels, which have attacked load ships. This situation affected the trade of goods from Portugal, with the sale of products such as olive oil, which took two months, twice the time, to circumvent the conflict zone. The main impact was felt at the level of fresh short products, such as cheeses, dairy products and premium meats, which became more expensive. HM spoke to a Portuguese businessman who imports Portuguese products and who, due to delays in maritime transport, began to choose the airway. Despite the increase in transportation costs, Stock management forced looking for alternatives to the sea route, which takes three months to turn on Portugal to Macau.

item.title: Satellite casinos | SME admit agony with closures
item.description:
Several entrepreneurs from small and medium-sized companies have admitted that with the end of the satellite casinos will have to close their business or move on to mass discharge
Dependent companies or with great revenues generated by the satellite casinos recognize that they are very concerned about the prospects of a closing wave at the end of the year. The position of several entrepreneurs was taken in statements to the newspaper or Mun. Satellite casinos result from agreements between some independent dealers and companies, which explore various game spaces, as with Kam Pek or Bridge 16 casinos, a total of 11 casinos. In this model, the independent companies exploit casinos, but with workers, game tables and chips of the dealers, with whom they have an agreement and who make payments. The last review of the game law established a period of three years to end this model, which ends later this year. As a result, dealers may choose to assume, by themselves, the exploration of these casinos or close the spaces. Speaking to the newspaper or Mun, a resident with the nickname Lam, who is responsible for a software company, said half of the company's revenues derive from one of the satellite casinos. Without these revenues, the leader admits that the company will start losing money and that in this scenario there are only two hypotheses: paying the losses with money from their pocket, until the situation becomes unsustainable, or doing what nicknamed “cutting an arm”, the dismissal of about 30 to 40 percent of workers. Lam also said that satellite casinos distribute a lot of money to small and medium enterprises by hiring services. However, if only the dealership survives, the local economy will feel an impact it has classified as deep. Another businessman, with the nickname Sin, responsible for a cleaning company, traveled a similar scenario, and acknowledged that with the closure of the satellite casinos will say goodbye to the total of the total staff, which indicated to represent about 100 workers, due to lack of work. Less transportation The need to move forward with the dismissal of workers is also the scenario before Choi, according to the newspaper or Mun. The entrepreneur of a private personnel transport company said that it currently survives in the local market due to services rendered to the satellite casinos. Choi acknowledged that 80 percent of the recipes come from these spaces and that in case of closing this volume of business will not be replaced. The businessman indicated that although Macau receives more tourists these have a very different profile. Among the differences, he pointed out that they are younger and do not move through this type of transport, first resorting to public transport. The newspaper or Mun also spoke to another IP businessman, responsible for an advertising lighting product company. It employs between 20 and 30 workers and most services are provided to the satellite casinos. If they end, IP indicates that not only will your company close, as well as several other stores in the vicinity of casinos and depend on them.

item.title: Domestic Violence | Ho Ion Sang asks resources to help victims
item.description:
Despite the “success” of domestic violence policies, the residents' deputy considers that local associations must have more means to support victims and their children. In addition to subsistence means, Ho Ion Sang highlights the importance of planning professional career and providing child care
Ho Ion Sang advocates the reinforcement of cooperation between the government and local associations to provide victims of domestic violence with more subsistence means. The subject is addressed through a interpelation written by the residents' deputy, in which greater cooperation between the government and local associations is requested. In the document, Ho advocates the reinforcement of the “social assistance network” and the improvement of “support for the level of subsistence means of domestic violence and children”, which involves not only the availability of financial support, but also by “more oriented and diverse services, such as career planning, vocational training and child care”. According to the deputy, in the current context, associations should assume a key role in helping victims in life after episodes of domestic violence, in cases where they need a network of support to rebuild their lives. Ho Ion Sang is a deputy for the residents' association, one of the most supported by the government with public funds. More cooperation The reinforcement of cooperation between local associations and the government is not only intended to request more resources. Ho Ion Sang asks for the development of guidelines, promised by the executive for this year, who will define ways to deal with cases of domestic violence when there are children involved. In the questions sent to the government, the deputy recalls that the guidelines were completed in 2023, and that last year the authorities heard public services and associations. However, the executive's goal was to publicize and implement the guidelines throughout this year, without more information so far. Therefore, the deputy asks the government to reveal the calendar when they will be presented. In written interplies, the deputy also considers that “cooperation with non -governmental organizations and consolidate resources from all parties involved” to “create a favorable atmosphere for the whole community to oppose and unanimously resist domestic violence”. Regarding prevention, Ho Ion Sang praises the work carried out, with the approval of the legislation that made this a public crime, which has led to a gradual reduction of occurrences. However, it asks the executive not to make it easier for the efforts to combat crime to alert the population more to this phenomenon.

item.title: Literature | Dora Nunes Gago closes Macau's trilogy with “gray flowers”
item.description:
Dora Nunes Gago, writer and former director of the Portuguese Department of Portuguese, has just launched a new poetry book. "Flowers of Gray" ends the trilogy of works dedicated to Macau, composed of "flowered by mistake the angry roses" and "Nomadic Words"
It was ten years that translated into many words. So many, who gave three books, “they were mistakenly flowered to the angry roses”, clearly reference to Camilo Pessanha; “Nomadic Words” and now “Gray Flowers”. Dora Nunes Gago's new poetry book, a teacher and former director of the Portuguese Department of Macao (one), also refers to Macau who lasts in his memory and, therefore, translates into words. With the seal of Humus, the book has just left Portugal, resulting from the "many poems" written by Dora Nunes Gago during the period in Macao, an experience that turned her into an published and award -winning author. Writing poetry in these years of teaching and experience the East turned out to be the way found to deal with Macau's reviliations and their dynamics. “Perhaps because it is a shorter record, a way to capture moments, of crystallizing them, in the midst of all the bullshit and surprises that Macau dresses. Maria Ondina Braga referred to the work“ Statue de Sal ”, written in Macao, around 1963, that Macau is 'sleep of sleep and poetry'. Hm. “Gray Flowers” ​​is called because he went to seek inspiration from a poem by Natália Correia: “(…) young people oblivious to the pulcitude of the body in celebration / pass me as cypresses of cypresses / And the youth gray flower is an edge / strike me by opening vacuums of wild flowers (…) / the gallop in a teeth foam.” Dora Nunes Gago selected the “surviving poems” of the remaining two titles of the trilogy. “There were those who were lost, between changes, travel, blocks and lost notebooks.” Like the whole macao's own revocation. In "Gray Flowers," the territory "is represented by rituals, the symbolic times like the Chinese New Year, which is that festive time when the world is reborn and inventing itself." There are also elements that become poetry such as the dumplings, the temples, the island of Hengqin, where the author lived in the days she taught at one. “The territory is present in the images, but also in the solitude and silence that inhabits the poems, all of them very short. In this book, my obsession with synthesis culminated,” he describes. Each book, a message Há poemas que falam por si só, outros que necessitam de ser explicados. And speaking of the trilogy he has written in recent years, Dora Nunes Gago refers to the first, where the pessanha symbolism is sought and where he denotes "the first look at Asia and Macao." Here there is no poetry, but 24 tales, "many of them inspired by witnessed stories, heard or read in newspapers." Already the award -winning “Nomadic Words”, winner of the Grand Travel Literature Prize Maria Ondina Braga last year, contains 50 chronicles. "It was the way to find a guiding thread to unite various experiences and learning that had a conductive thread for my life." Behold, in the last book of the trilogy, 55 poems, organized into three parts, namely “exhibitions, permanences and returns” are gathered. They are “a synthesis of all my route,” he says. “Gray Flowers” ​​is “Perhaps the most autobiographical book of the three, as it is rooted in multiple feelings, in a kind of instantaneous ones that configured my days,” says the author. From the preface, by Maria João Cantinho, it is read that the first of the trilogy, “flowered by mistake the Brave roses” is “a book of brief stories, whose title was taken from loan to a beautiful verse (and a poem) of the melancholy Camilo Pessanha, in Clepsidra”. While "nomadic words" brings together chronic chronicles that are born "from his experience in Macao, as well as his traveler and adventurous aspect, as the Teotónio Almeida needed very praised." In turn, in the third, Dora Gago "changes the record and we find ourselves in the face of poetic and sensitive writing, built by brief poems," he reads. Maria João Cantinho also understands that the poem “Destiny” is one of the most beautiful in “Flowers of Gray”: “In the crazy run / of the abandoned / lonely Galgo of existing, lick the wounds of death / in the skin of the poem.” Here, it is described “poetic writing is presented as vertigo (‘ in the crazy race ’) driven by a allegorical impetus, in which the presence of death emerges”, where “fate is certainly this disadvantaged race in which death surrounds the living and only the poem can save or redeem those”, considers Maria João Cantinho. For this, "Dora Nunes Gago's writing contains a reflective dimension, addressing topics such as the creation or passage of time, among many others, and using a rich, vocabulary and prosodic level language in the search for effects that accentuate the tension of the poem." “Exiles”, the first part of the work, starts with “beginning”, a simple name for a short poem: “I follow the memory footprints / inscribed in the sand of time / and I am a ship / anchored without leme / no breath”. Perhaps marked by longing and distance, we find “absence”: “They dance solemn ashes / Silvando Winds of Saudade, / Heavens / Spelled / In Blood / Solitude.” And as this book is made of comings and goings, the work ends with "return", as if it was a timeline: "Returning the house / tattooing hills and valleys / in the retina, / watering the flowers of gray / reborn / in stony cracks / of hope." Dora Nunes Gago is a native of São Brás de Alportel and is currently a teacher at the Setúbal Polytechnic Institute. About “Nomadic Words”, the Jury of the Grand Prix of Travel Literature Maria Ondina Braga, granted by the Portuguese Writers Association (APE), considered it to be a “work of varied and rich observations concerning the places where the reports of great sensory liveliness go, which does not lack the intimate look at the places and people, as well as the capture of what is capable of the capture of what has been captured of what has been captured of what is has been capturing designating as 'Génie du Lieu' ”. "In a prose of great fluidity, eavized of reflections where perceptions, memories, culture, literature and history are intersected, the author has been able to lead a reading reading from the first pages, whose rhythm and interest can maintain throughout the considerable extension of the work," said the same jury.

item.title: Letters & Company | Launched Chinese version of “The Adventurous Trip of the Fatherland”
item.description:
Launched in November last year, in Portugal, the children's book “The Adventurous Trip of the Fatherland”, by Filipa Brito Pais, is presented this Saturday at the Letters & Company Festival, but in Chinese version-“祖国号” 的冒险之旅 (1924). This is the history of the first air trip between Vila Nova de Mil-Fontes and Macau starring the airmen Sarmento Beires, Brito Pais and Manuel Gouveia
The Children's Festival Letters & Company, promoted by the Portuguese Institute of the East (IPOR), hosts this Saturday the launch of the Chinese version of “The Adventurous Journey of the Fatherland”, a book by Filipa Brito Pais, teachers, telling the story of the first air trip between Portugal and Macau starring the Author, Brito Paisvô, and Menuel Macavô Gouveia. Last year the centenary of this trip was celebrated, and hence Filipa wanted to tell her to a younger audience. The work has illustrations by Leonor Almeida. In a press release, Filipa Brito Pais describes that “as a teacher of the first cycle, I have been to several schools in Portugal and Macau to fulfill my memory duty to my uncle”. Thus, “the possibility of writing a children's book that would accompany me in the lectures I give, due to the lack of appropriate information to the younger audience, and has been successful in the more adult audience”. “The adventurous trip of the homeland” has a preface by the president of the Portuguese Republic, Marcelo Rebelo de Sousa, as well as the support of several entities linked to Macau. At a time when the version translated to Chinese is known, the work has already been presented to over 2500 students in schools and municipal libraries in Portugal. It was up to the translation of the work. At the time of launch in Portugal, Filipa Brito Pais told HM that many stories of the trip had to be left out, but this is a tribute to heroes who were forgetting in Portuguese historiography. “It does not portray all the steps, because it would be impossible for it to be for children. It is a book whose story is very reduced, even at the request of my editor, because I wanted to put all the adventures and adventures they lived. The story of writing on the plane screen in the match was one of the fact that Manuel Gouveia [the mechanic] was said to die. Another of the bath taken to cold water that was then boiling water, ”he said. For the author, they are adventures "demonstrations of courage and perseverance, leadership ability," this is a book with a strong message, so that young people "do not give up their dreams." Feed memory In the same note sent to the newspapers, Filipa Brito Pais describes the fact that “these national heroes [have been] forgotten in history for political reasons”, namely by opposing one of the airmen to the 1926 military dictatorship. The fact that the dictatorial regime of the Estado Novo was instituted a few years later in Portugal in 1933, further contributed to this aerial achievement. To make the trip, several popular background capture campaigns were created, but the best known air route was the trip of Gago Coutinho and Sacadura Cabral. "I had the honor of having been present in June 2024 in Macao and Hong Kong when the celebrations of the centenary of my uncle's trip, representing the Brito Pais family. I will now have the greatest honor of presenting the book in Chinese and honoring these three Portuguese heroes in the diaspora," he said. “Brito Pais and Sarmento de Beires dreamed of flying and honoring the homeland and Camões, choosing the destination of Macao, which at that time was Portuguese land. Without financial support and with an old and heavy plane, they risked and flew over countries that until then no one had dared to fly. Hm.

item.title: Tariffs | Japan says negotiations with USA include exchange rates
item.description: Japanese finance minister Katsunobu Kato yesterday indicated that the exchange rate between the dollar and the yen will be on the table in negotiations with the United States about tariffs. Kato has confirmed what analysts have been suggesting, based on the priority objective of the United States to reduce trade balance with countries with which they have deficit and to which tariffs -which he calls reciprocal -like Japan. "There have been several communications with the American side, including over exchange rates, and then movements in the exchange markets may be among the topics discussed, although the details have not yet been determined," Kato said in a speech in the Japanese parliament. The leader also explained that discussions about the exchange rate will be held among the finance ministers of both countries. The Japanese government announced on Tuesday that the minister responsible for economic revitalization and new capitalism, Ryosi Akazawa, will be Tokyo's main representative in tariff negotiations. Washington, in turn, appointed the duo graduated by Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent and commercial representative Jamieson Greer to lead the team.

item.title: Commerce | Suppliers ask for autonomy to American products
item.description: To avoid the impact of US tariffs, the Macao suppliers' union association advocates greater gradual autonomy from imported products in America. The idea came from the association's president, IP Sio Man, according to the Chinese channel of Radio Macau. According to IP, US dependence is negative because tariff policies are unpredictable and are constantly changing. The official indicated that last year, the value of products Macau exported to the US was 300 million patacas, while the value of imported products from the US was 70 billion patacas. On the other hand, IP Sio Man anticipated that the Macao government is unable to follow the interior in adopting retaliation policies against the US, so it should follow an alternative path. But even though Macau follows the background policy, IP has devalued the case, considering that it will not have great impact, because in recent years, Macau has actively explored new markets and can import products from other regions to replace those of the US.

item.description: * Assistant and coordinator researcher at the Macau Scientific and Cultural Center I The old silk routes Two routes connected the Han Dynasty to the West from the second century BC. The South and North Route, both extended from Chang 'an/XI's to the West, the North through Central Asia, the Caspian Sea, and the South, led to the Mediterranean, Genoa and Venice, Irah and Iraq. Historically, the old silk route divided into four periods: From the second century BC to the 6th century, having as high points the diffusion of the Buddhism and emergency of Islam; 2) From the beginning of the seventh century to the late tenth century, the highlight being the diffusion of porcelain; 3) From the eleventh century to the fifteenth century, with the heyday of the diffusion of Islamic and Hindu religions and tax trade in East Asia, the relics of the wreck and 7 trips of Admiral Zheng He (鄭和), between 1405-1431, as well as the emergence of multicultural communities such as Guangzhou, Malaca (Malásia) and Galle (Sri Lanka); 4) mid -century. XV to the nineteenth, with emphasis on the exchange of porcelain goods, peppers and spices, globalization of routes and diffusion of Catholicism, and the predominance of other routes, such as those opened by the Portuguese in the Atlantic to the Pacific, through the Indian Indian, especially the Cape Route. This route started in the 15th and 16th centuries in Lisbon reached India, China and Japan, particularly Nagasaqui, and beyond, Timor, in a project that begins to be outlined by D. João II in 1487, being fulfilled by D. Manuel 1, with the fleet led by Vasco da Gama that would lead to India, near Calecute on May 17, 1498. Of course China aims to ensure its sources of energy supply, either oil and natural gas, to which a hub from some central Asian countries, such as Turquemenistan, Kazakhstan, Uzbekistan and Russia, “being China since 2014 the largest world importer” (ibidem). Also according to data provided by Fernanda Ilhéu, since China joined the World Trade Organization in 2001, she was preparing her way to become an increasingly international economy, reaching in 2010 the Statute of Second World Economy (Ilhéu, 2018, 147). The country to maintain this statute, or perhaps even overcome it, needs to continue with its plan of 4 or 5 modernizations, maintaining the connection abroad for this purpose, that is, the Going Out policy has to continue. Thus transit a first phase of globalization, that of direct exports and foreign direct investment abroad (IDEE), for a second phase of globalization, as stressed Ilhéu (2018, 149) in the form of mergers and acquisitions in Asia, Europe and Africa, as well as in the Americas or Oceania. Then comes a new sea route from the silk that extends from Chongqing to Fuzhou in southern China, passes through Malaca in Malaysia, goes to Mombaça in Kenya (branch to Cape Verde and Santos in Brazil), heads to the Chinese African military base in Djibouti, then to the port of Pyreu in Greece (Ramifications for Madrid and Sines and Brazil), for Venice) Italy and Rotterdam in the Netherlands (branches for Panama and South American countries). Places related to the silk sea route within China are the coastal regions of Hebei, Jiangsu, Shanghai, Zhejiang, Fujian, Guangdong, Guangxi, Hainan and Macao Special Administrative Region, as well as the Huang-Bohai seas, Changjiang River Basin, East China Sea and Taiwan's Strait, Senior China Sea, Japan archipelago, Korea Peninsula, which is the plaque of East Asia. However, a new sea silk route begins to draw, the polar silk route, which would suppose China, Norway, and Groelândia, into Arctic, to facilitate trade between Asia, Europe and America. The Arctic Route comes out of Shanghai passes through Alaska crosses the North Pole to Denmark to Rotterdão, and from there he can go to the land, passing to China, or using the Rotterdam Silk Route goes to Pyreu, crosses the Suez Channel, Momba, Kolkata (India), Malaca Strait, Jakarta to Zhanjiang (China). The evolution of the new silk route in the next decade will depend on the growth of the Chinese economy, which according to Thiago Codongo, commercial manager of China Link, will have to grow more than 6% per year to support support and investments, such as the ones they have done in Angola, Venezuela, Pakistan and Mongolia, all these countries with great debts to China. As Professor Carlos Gaspar (2020) saw in The World of Tomorrow: Contemporary Geopolitics, China performs through the initiative of the Track and Route (Bri) of its various silk corridors, terrestrial, maritime and polar, a strategy of political, economic, cultural and technological connectivity. Notable advances in mobile telecommunications are distinguished here, such as the 5G network and also in port and rail infrastructure. The big question is to know if the domain of seas is equivalent to that of the world, which in the space age does not seem to be the case, although China has been rivaling the United States in this domain, and not only in the quality of the second largest economic power, ambitions are equally political wishing to offer a counterpart to a long -dominated unipole. item.description: The capital of Timor-Leste will receive tomorrow and Saturday the sixth ministerial meeting of the G7+ that will first join the heads of the organization's diplomacy, which marks 15 years of existence. G7+ is a forum in which member countries seek to influence global discourse on peace, stability and resilience, as well as define joint actions to achieve those objectives. The Intergovernmental Organization was established on April 10, 2010, in Dili, and emerged with concern, shared by its Member States, that traditional development cooperation did not improve the situation of fragile nations. "The purpose of this meeting, the sixth G7+ministerial meeting, is to reflect on the progress achieved during the 15th anniversary of its establishment," said G7+Secretary-General, Helder da Costa. item.title: LAG 2025 | Checks, economy and great bay should be sam hu fai bets
item.description:
The government lines for this year are presented on Monday, marking the debut of Sam Hou Fai in one of the most anticipated moments of the local political calendar. Game recipes and economic predictions should be on the table, according to José Sales Marques and Lou Shenghua. The future of pecuniary checks may be another matter to be in attention
Sam Hou Fai has been in the government for almost five months and is preparing to present, next Monday, his first report of the Governing Action Lines (LAG) for this year. Great expectations often reside in the amounts of pecuniary checks, the values ​​attributed to social support and other budgetary predictions, especially after the territory has been through a hard economic period with Covid-19. LAG 2025 should focus on these themes, and Macao's integration into the various regional cooperation projects, such as Hengqin Island or the Great Guangdong-Hong Kong-Macau Bay. Fulfilling the annual tradition of local politics, Sam Hou Fai made the usual round of auscultations to local associations, in order to know his opinions on the main measures to take. Listened to by HM, economist José Sales Marques expects clarity in the policies announced at the economic level. "I would like to see these LAG bring greater clarity on economic policies and the vision for the future of MSAR. I speak of structural measures that encourage the trust of the private investor, and that also realize such reforms of public administration to increase efficiency and effectiveness," he said. Sales Marques also said that "I would like to clearly see Macao's positions and priorities in his relationship with countries and regions of the world, including measures that lead to deepen the role of Sino-Midfone and Multicultural Dialogue Platform." Lou Shenghua, a political analyst and professor at Macao Polytechnic University (UPM), said the main ideas presented will be in accordance with what Sam Hou Fai presented in the electoral program. "The tonic can be placed in improving the effectiveness of governance, moderate economic diversification, the construction of the Hengqin cooperation zone and the issues related to the subsistence means of people," said the analyst, stressing that "citizens may be more concerned with subsistence -related issues." And what program presented Sam Hou Fai in September last year, when it was glimpsed that he would be the only candidate for the position of Chief Executive? A program that has as its “maximum objective to meet citizens' expectations for a better life” and the “fundamental orientation of implementing the principle of a country, two systems” in a full, correct and firm way ”. The importance of national security was not forgotten, referring to the need for defense “of sovereignty, security and interests of the country's development”. About the sin, Sam Hou Fai said he wanted to erect a "macao based on the rule of law, dynamic, cultural and happy." The then only candidate to head the government promised to improve the government's governing capacity. "We will strive to raise the capacity and level of governance of MSAR, the change in the concepts of governance, the optimization of the form of governance, the persistence of macao governance in accordance with the law, and the deepening of the reform of public administration and the legal system." Thus, he said "optimizing forms of governance, giving greater importance to the role of advisory bodies, experts and academics, and love associations of the country and Macao, widely listening to the opinions and suggestions of various sectors, different industry branches and various social strata." It remains to be seen if the lag will bring these tin aspects to the field of actions and concrete measures. MATE On Monday, the agenda continues as usual in the presentation of a report of the lag. First Sam Hou Fai will go to the Legislative Assembly, from 15h, make a general presentation to the deputies of political and budgetary issues essential for this year, followed by a press conference. The next day, it is a day of debate in the hemicycle on the same report, then followed the sectoral debates with all secretaries until the 30th of this month. One of the political themes that have been in the DAY ORDER is the value of pecuniary checks and whether or not they are attributed to residents living outside Macao. There are analysts to defend the reformulation of the program, but Sales Marques recalls that "the amount expected for pecuniary checks in the budget discussion for 2025 is 10,000 patacas for permanent residents." “Predicted budget revenues were based on calculation a gross revenue forecast of 240 billion patacas to an average of 20 billion per month. It turns out that the effective revenues obtained until the end of the first quarter of this year were short, with a deviation of less than four billion. be hit. ” Given these less optimistic predictions, referred to by the Secretary himself for the economy and finance, Tai Kin IP last week, Sales Marques believes that, if there are adjustments in the checks, will be "small". "As for the distribution method, I predict that it remains the same," he said. Lou Shenghua believes that "the pecuniary reimbursement plan may change." "In terms of amount, it is likely to maintain the value of ten thousand patacas per resident, but regarding the form, it can be attributed to consumer valleys," he said. Last day 1, Secretary Tai Kin IP said the budget accounts are still short of expected. "We noticed that in the first three months of 2025 the gross revenues of the games reached 57.66 billion patacas, remaining the value almost unchanged in annual terms, not yet reaching the expected monthly average of 20 billion patacas." Thus, it was left the warning that "this year's financial revenues may not be as optimistic as it is expected", and it is necessary to "seriously study the future economic situation and persist in the management of financial resources with prudence." Game and other stories Regarding the game sector, which has continued to have a predominant weight in the economy, Sam Hou Fai confirmed a month ago that concessionaires and satellite casinos have until the end of the year to prepare the transition to a subconsers' exploration model. It will be in the "hands" of the dealers to decide whether or not to explore these casinos directly. For Sales Marques, this dossier “worries several sectors of society, not only about the use of its workers, but also for the repercussion that will close in the areas of the city where they are, especially in retail and restoration trade, small trade in general”. Thus, "it will be prudent to avoid great shocks in the current conjuncture." "Everything will be done to regularize these units under the law in force, without provoking their immediate closure," he added. Lou Shenghua hopes to “have room for negotiation about the distribution of revenues between the satellite casinos and the dealers”. Despite the concerns that reside in the unemployment of these people, Sam Hou Fai advanced in March to TDM that these fears can be removed. "I know that satellite casinos workers are distributed to the game companies, so operators have the responsibility of absorbing them or having plans for these workers," he said. Laws for I want you Given the history of Sam Hou Fai in court, as it has presided over the court of last instance since the establishment of the MSAR, some new measures can be expected in the area of ​​law. Sales Marques deposits expectations in the creation of new regulations “that are more facilitators to the operation of the economy”, quite “more favorable to the competitive business environment of this Great Bay region, namely as to the hiring of qualified human resources, conditions offered to their stay and that of their families and less bureaucratic administratives”. Lou Shenghua believes it could, in fact, “pay more attention to legal reform,” although it should be in accordance with government policies and follow the pace of times, not being reformed just because yes, ”he said.

item.title: Book | Mark O'Neill tells the history of Europeans in the early days of Hong Kong
item.description:
“Europeans in Hong Kong” is the 18th and new book by British writer and journalist Mark O'Neill, who lives in the neighboring region. At HM, he confesses that he began to write the history of the Irish, but the project eventually expanded. As such, it focused on the stories of Europeans who left their brand in Hong Kong, including Portuguese
Hong Kong, the city of banking, finance and commerce, a worldwide warehouse for centuries and a gateway to China. It has been the neighboring region throughout the time, since its institution, in 1841. Hong Kong has always been an international territory populated by Europeans of various nationalities, much more than the British who administered the territory until 1997. It was missing to tell its story, and British author and journalist Mark O'Neill, residing in Hong Kong since the late 1970s, now has it now with “European Europeans in Hong Kong], which even includes a chapter about the Portuguese. In another work that has just left the newsstands, the author confesses to HM who began to write the history of the Irish in Hong Kong, whose contribution to the "was huge" territory. This work was not published, being born later the idea of ​​doing something bigger. “I chose the figures that made the greatest contributions, especially at the religious level, or teachers, writers, great figures in the business world and those whose legacies still last,” he confessed. Mark O'Neill points out that the great contribution of Europeans in the neighboring region took place in the educational area, but not only. "The most lasting contribution was given by schools, universities, hospitals, homes of elderly, social assistance institutions and some companies. Although they are entities that are currently managed, largely, by people from Hong Kong, were founded and fed by Europeans." O autor explica que a história mais impressionante associada ao legado dos franceses surge na capa do livro. “No século XIX, as freiras francesas adoptaram dezenas de milhares de raparigas chinesas que tinham sido abandonadas e deram-lhes uma boa vida. Sem elas, as raparigas teriam morrido ou trabalhado como mão-de-obra infantil, empregadas domésticas ou prostitutas”, disse. Another house Asked about the new perceptions that the book can bring to the general public, Mark O'Neill understands that he is today "familiar with the history of British in Hong Kong, but not with the history of continental Europe." Thus, the author says he hopes that "the book will help them understand their history, especially their contribution." In general terms, "in the early decades [of the Hong Kong Foundation], Europeans were, above all, business men and missionaries, both Catholic and Protestants." Then the region grew “as a great Asian city and, from the 1950s, the community expanded.” "Currently, we have architects, engineers, musicians, teachers, restaurant owners, doctors, lawyers, art and people experts in all the domains of life," said the author. Another prominent figure in “Europeans in Hong Kong” is the Jesuit Hungarian Father Laszlo Ladany, considered “China's greatest observer in the world for thirty years”, and Anders Nelson, “Swedish singer and long-term resident in Hong Kong, well known to local inhabitants”, describes the introduction of the work. “Most people think that Hong Kong was built by the Chinese during their 150 years of British dominance, which is not entirely accurate. As the reader will discover, many of the schools, social assistance institutions, buildings and companies in the city were founded and managed by people from Europe (defined here as 'east of calais'). They forced it, ”is described in the same introduction. Mark O'Neill also describes that the Hong Kong cemeteries contain traces of this presence, as "Europeans have enjoyed the city and their people more than their homeland." The European presence increased in the neighboring region from 1949, when the People's Republic of China is founded, as "the new Chinese government closed the doors to foreigners, with the exception of a small number of people from other socialist countries." Thus, "eager to remain in China and in the Chinese world, many Europeans have moved from mainland China to Hong Kong," he is mentioned. The Macaense Legacy The fourth chapter is entirely dedicated to the Portuguese and Macaense Hong Kong community, regarded as a “pillar of society” for many years. “For 150 years, the Portuguese were, after the British, the largest non-Chinese community in Hong Kong,” reads the work, which draws the profile of five personalities and describes two social clubs where the community was. Regarding the personalities, the example of José Pedro Braga, the first Portuguese to be part of the Legislative Council, between 1927 and 1937; Sir Roger Lobo, member of the Executive Council between 1967 and 1985; and Commander Arnaldo de Oliveira Sales, first president of the urban council between 1973 and 1981. "The Portuguese played a key role in the government, in banks, the liberal professions and the commercial companies. They lived here for many generations. Most of the expatriates were only the time of their mission; when they renovated, departed and returned to Britain or another country in Europe. book. Regarding the origin of this community, it is described as a “mixed race”, or macanese, but also Portuguese with Asian origins. “Its history dates back to hundreds of years, in the early days of Portuguese trade and exploitation. In the 16th century, Portugal established commercial warehouses and religious missions in Goa, Malaca, Macau and Nagasaki. The Portuguese settlers married local women, creating a mixed root population in India, Malaysia, China and Japan. In 1639, the Japanese government expelled all foreigners and foreigners and isolated the country from the rest of the world. ” Macao emerges closely linked to this community, as it became, in the mid-16th century, “the basis of Portugal in East Asia” after the Dutch blocked Goa and won Malacca. "The Macanese began to form as a cohesive community-sharing ties with Portugal, the Catholic religion, a common language and kitchen and a feeling of distinction from the Portuguese colonials and their Chinese neighbors. They were the only people in Macao who spoke Portuguese and Cantonese, giving them a role of intermediaries essential for the proper functioning of government and business," he is explained. The fact that “the Hong Kong foundation has devastated the economy of Macao” made many macanese began to move from weapons and luggage to a much more brightly saving zone. After all, "just 66 kilometers away [Hong Kong] was the best deep water port in southern China within laws, administration and military protection in the largest empire in the world."

item.title: EPM | Paulo Rangel guarantees increased financial support after 11 years of cuts
item.description:
On a lightning visit to Macao, Portugal's Foreign Minister argued that the position the country maintains in the European Union does not affect the relationship with China. During Paulo Rangel's visit, it was also announced that Sam Hou Fai should visit Portugal during the summer
He met with Sam Hou Fai, with counselors from the Portuguese communities, associative representatives, Portuguese educational institutions and entrepreneurs. Thus was the visit of Paulo Rangel, Minister of Foreign Affairs of Portugal, in the short visit to the MSAR, which took place on Friday. There are no passages in the Portuguese School of Macau (EPM) and the Consulate General of Portugal in the territory. In the late afternoon, Paulo Rangel also moved to Hong Kong to visit the exhibition “Lusas Stories”, dedicated to the Portuguese community of the territory, patent at the Hong Kong History Museum. In China, Paulo Rangel was present at the Boao Forum in Haião. In an interview with TDM, the minister assured that Portugal's relations with China remain good, denying that the country's position in the European Union's position (EU) can represent some kind of obstacle. "Anyone who thinks that Portugal's presence in the EU is harmful to Portugal's relationship with China, does not realize Portugal's relationship with China and does not realize the role of Portugal in the international picture. I realize that some people do not understand, but honestly we have to see it as more value. And this is seen like this," he said. One of the voices that criticized Portugal's position in relation to stories such as the issue of Huawei and Rede 5G was Amelia António, lawyer and president of the House of Portugal in Macau. “My expectation is not high. I would like you minister, after visiting China, to say something friendly, as relationships have been very loose. I would like to see this relationship resumed as usual and also that we were not as followers of the EU positions, so fiercely, because we have very special interests and we have a very large Portuguese community. It should not be lost sight of, ”he told Paulo Rangel to Macao. The EPM question In the interview given to TDM, Paulo Rangel also commented on the issue of EPM, stressing the points that were not on the agenda, namely the works of expansion of the facilities. "This question has not yet been addressed. There are, in fact, several issues that have to be detailed and resolved, and one or the other that have not yet been put on the table. We know that there is search for it, but and I am being totally transparent, it is a question that is not yet on the table." According to Lusa, Paulo Rangel also announced that the government increased financial support to the EPM, returning to the legally expected level after 11 years of cuts. "We just replaced the Portuguese contribution to the Portuguese School of Macao, which (…) had suffered a huge cut," Rangel said on Friday. The Portuguese State holds the majority (51 percent) of the capital of the EPM foundation, but since 2014 that Lisbon only contributed with 10 percent of school expenses, a decision taken under the Portuguese financial rescue program. EPM financing “is now at legal levels again and is the first time at the end of 11 years,” he said. Shortly thereafter, the chief of Portuguese diplomacy told reporters that "there was no reason, honestly, to have this cut and he remained." "We have increased five times this value [of EPM financing], so this is something that is highly significant from the commitment we have." "There are governments that really give importance to Macau and China and there are others who do not give, this is something that has to be said," lamented the minister, pointing his finger at the previous executive of the Socialist Party. The replacement of financing “is undoubtedly an important help” for EPM, which Rangel described as having a key role for Portugal in Macau. "We also have pleased ... that there have never been so many Portuguese students - and now I speak of students from the Chinese community - as there are today in multiple schools," added the leader. "It means that also the special administrative region [of Macau] has encouraged Portuguese teaching and knowledge of Portuguese, and this is something that can only bring good relations between the two sides," added Rangel. SAM in Portugal From the meeting with Sam Hou Fai, which also took place on Friday, some ideas and opinions on “bilateral exchange and cooperation in the judicial, economic-commercial, education, among others,” says an official note from the Social Communication Office. Sam Hou Fai led to the meeting topics such as “the most current development of the deepened cooperation zone between Guangdong and Macau in Henqing”, and remembered that “Paulo Rangel is the first foreign ministerial guardian he receives after the executive's head of the executive, a fact that reflects the good relations between Macao and Portugal with a longtime history”. The head of the executive also pointed out that after December 20, 1999, Macau, "with strong support from the central government, has insisted on maintaining the principle of" a country, two systems ", preserving the continental legal system, traditional culture and customs, as well as actively maintaining the connection and foster relations with Portugal." The ruler also said that "Macao has deepened the role of bridge and platform between China and Lusophone countries, continuously boosting the establishment of friendly relationships in the various areas of bilateral cooperation." Another novelty of this meeting was the information, advanced by Sam Hou Fai himself, which “expects to visit Portugal in the near future” without, however, a concrete date has been announced. Rangel announced that the chief executive of Macao is expected to visit Portugal "immediately before August or in September." "There is clearly here also an alignment of the priorities that is highly symbolic," said the diplomat, on the fringes of a meeting with the Portuguese community in Macau. Asked about the restrictions to Portuguese in accessing the resident status, Rangel said he spoke with Sam Hou Fai "on all the issues that are relevant to the relationship between Portugal and the MSAR." "But, as it is a dialogue that is underway, I have a duty to give the opportunity we can, with the questions that have been raised from one part and the other, now we have space and time to build solutions," he added. Rangel said that the "follow -up of dialogue" with Sam Hou Fai will take place at a meeting of the Portugal -Raem Joint Commission, "which will be organized in principle in the second semester here in Macao." Paulo Rangel also said, in an interview with TDM, that the visit of Marcelo Rebelo de Sousa, president of the Portuguese Republic, “will happen a little later”, precisely due to the marking of new elections in the country. Initially, the aim was that Marcelo Rebelo de Sousa came to Macao in June to commemorate Portugal, Camões and Portuguese communities. The visit should take place in the following months of summer, predicted Paulo Rangel. Encounters and mismatches Paulo Rangel also had a meeting with local associative representatives, including with the Portuguese communities counselor. Francisco Mannhão, president of the Macao Retirees, Reformed and Pensioners Association (Apomac), took the opportunity to talk about the bureaucracy that still exists in the relationship with the Caixa Geral de Retirement (CGA). "To dispatch a survival pension process takes six months and then the correspondence goes back and forth. Macao benches do not have Iban, and this, for example, delays the whole process. Whenever a process goes to CGA, they insist that they do not have the number of IBAN and NIF [Fiscal Identification Number], that most of the widows receiving survival pensions, do not have in Portugal." exemplified. Mannão also compliments to the Portuguese politician. "For a short time he was here, he showed concern. I liked the presence of the minister." In addition, Francisco Mannão stressed that “in a good time the Portuguese government appointed Alexandre Leitão to Consul”, also recalling the good work of the previous Portuguese consul, Vítor Sereno. "The consulate has never been as well functioned as now. The criticism made to our consul are unfair. There were our associates who told me to have been admired for making a marking and was attended the next day," he said. More bet on the language Another important point of Rangel's visit was the promise of the reinforcement of Mandarin teaching in Portugal. "With the Chinese authorities I made a point of saying that we will be very committed to teaching Chinese in Portugal." In the Chinese capital, Rangel met with Chinese counterpart, Wang Yi, before meeting with Chinese vice-minister, Ding Xuexiang, on Hailão Island, where the Boao Forum took place. "The situation today is much better than it was 20 years ago ... We have, in fact, a formation that we did not have at all," said Paulo Rangel. The formation of fluent people in Mandarin “is also decisive for our future”, but “it is not enough for the challenges we have ahead,” he warned. Lame

item.title: Literature | Dora Nunes Gago closes Macau's trilogy with “gray flowers”
item.description:
Dora Nunes Gago, writer and former director of the Portuguese Department of Portuguese, has just launched a new poetry book. "Flowers of Gray" ends the trilogy of works dedicated to Macau, composed of "flowered by mistake the angry roses" and "Nomadic Words"
It was ten years that translated into many words. So many, who gave three books, “they were mistakenly flowered to the angry roses”, clearly reference to Camilo Pessanha; “Nomadic Words” and now “Gray Flowers”. Dora Nunes Gago's new poetry book, a teacher and former director of the Portuguese Department of Macao (one), also refers to Macau who lasts in his memory and, therefore, translates into words. With the seal of Humus, the book has just left Portugal, resulting from the "many poems" written by Dora Nunes Gago during the period in Macao, an experience that turned her into an published and award -winning author. Writing poetry in these years of teaching and experience the East turned out to be the way found to deal with Macau's reviliations and their dynamics. “Perhaps because it is a shorter record, a way to capture moments, of crystallizing them, in the midst of all the bullshit and surprises that Macau dresses. Maria Ondina Braga referred to the work“ Statue de Sal ”, written in Macao, around 1963, that Macau is 'sleep of sleep and poetry'. Hm. “Gray Flowers” ​​is called because he went to seek inspiration from a poem by Natália Correia: “(…) young people oblivious to the pulcitude of the body in celebration / pass me as cypresses of cypresses / And the youth gray flower is an edge / strike me by opening vacuums of wild flowers (…) / the gallop in a teeth foam.” Dora Nunes Gago selected the “surviving poems” of the remaining two titles of the trilogy. “There were those who were lost, between changes, travel, blocks and lost notebooks.” Like the whole macao's own revocation. In "Gray Flowers," the territory "is represented by rituals, the symbolic times like the Chinese New Year, which is that festive time when the world is reborn and inventing itself." There are also elements that become poetry such as the dumplings, the temples, the island of Hengqin, where the author lived in the days she taught at one. “The territory is present in the images, but also in the solitude and silence that inhabits the poems, all of them very short. In this book, my obsession with synthesis culminated,” he describes. Each book, a message There are poems that speak for themselves, others who need to be explained. And speaking of the trilogy he has written in recent years, Dora Nunes Gago refers to the first, where the pessanha symbolism is sought and where he denotes "the first look at Asia and Macao." Here there is no poetry, but 24 tales, "many of them inspired by witnessed stories, heard or read in newspapers." Already the award -winning “Nomadic Words”, winner of the Grand Travel Literature Prize Maria Ondina Braga last year, contains 50 chronicles. "It was the way to find a guiding thread to unite various experiences and learning that had a conductive thread for my life." Behold, in the last book of the trilogy, 55 poems, organized into three parts, namely “exhibitions, permanences and returns” are gathered. They are “a synthesis of all my route,” he says. “Gray Flowers” ​​is “Perhaps the most autobiographical book of the three, as it is rooted in multiple feelings, in a kind of instantaneous ones that configured my days,” says the author. From the preface, by Maria João Cantinho, it is read that the first of the trilogy, “flowered by mistake the Brave roses” is “a book of brief stories, whose title was taken from loan to a beautiful verse (and a poem) of the melancholy Camilo Pessanha, in Clepsidra”. While "nomadic words" brings together chronic chronicles that are born "from his experience in Macao, as well as his traveler and adventurous aspect, as the Teotónio Almeida needed very praised." In turn, in the third, Dora Gago "changes the record and we find ourselves in the face of poetic and sensitive writing, built by brief poems," he reads. Maria João Cantinho also understands that the poem “Destiny” is one of the most beautiful in “Flowers of Gray”: “In the crazy run / of the abandoned / lonely Galgo of existing, lick the wounds of death / in the skin of the poem.” Here, it is described “poetic writing is presented as vertigo (‘ in the crazy race ’) driven by a allegorical impetus, in which the presence of death emerges”, where “fate is certainly this disadvantaged race in which death surrounds the living and only the poem can save or redeem those”, considers Maria João Cantinho. For this, "Dora Nunes Gago's writing contains a reflective dimension, addressing topics such as the creation or passage of time, among many others, and using a rich, vocabulary and prosodic level language in the search for effects that accentuate the tension of the poem." “Exiles”, the first part of the work, starts with “beginning”, a simple name for a short poem: “I follow the memory footprints / inscribed in the sand of time / and I am a ship / anchored without leme / no breath”. Perhaps marked by longing and distance, we find “absence”: “They dance solemn ashes / Silvando Winds of Saudade, / Heavens / Spelled / In Blood / Solitude.” And as this book is made of comings and goings, the work ends with "return", as if it was a timeline: "Returning the house / tattooing hills and valleys / in the retina, / watering the flowers of gray / reborn / in stony cracks / of hope." Dora Nunes Gago is a native of São Brás de Alportel and is currently a teacher at the Setúbal Polytechnic Institute. About “Nomadic Words”, the Jury of the Grand Prix of Travel Literature Maria Ondina Braga, granted by the Portuguese Writers Association (APE), considered it to be a “work of varied and rich observations concerning the places where the reports of great sensory liveliness go, which does not lack the intimate look at the places and people, as well as the capture of what is capable of the capture of what has been captured of what has been captured of what is has been capturing designating as 'Génie du Lieu' ”. "In a prose of great fluidity, eavized of reflections where perceptions, memories, culture, literature and history are intersected, the author has been able to lead a reading reading from the first pages, whose rhythm and interest can maintain throughout the considerable extension of the work," said the same jury.

The EPM case Another point that Amelia António and Miguel de Senna Fernandes want to see approached on Paulo Rangel's visit is the situation at the Portuguese School of Macau (EPM) and the lack of teachers. "I think you should see the school and make a little more awareness of the situation, although the EPM is not from its area. As a member of the government it is important to realize that this situation has been poorly conducted, because in Portugal has been gone after some conversations that have little to do with reality and only harm. If he realized a little more of the situation, it would not be bad," said Amelia António. Already Miguel de Senna Fernandes says that it is time for the Portuguese executive to stop looking at the school as another Portuguese educational institution abroad. “EPM is always a recurring question, and it all depends on how the Portuguese state looks at school: if you look like any Portuguese school spread around the world, this is a mistake. There is no possible comparison, because the EPM emerged in a very special context.” However, to Lusa agency, Jorge Neto Valente, president of the EPM foundation, was categorical: the school “has nothing to peddling” to Paulo Rangel. "There is no whimper, we have nothing to do, we have nothing to demand, everything is normal," he said. The lawyer and president of the founding of the EPM said he hoped Rangel "take a correct perception of the school, what it is for, the goals he has." “It's always good to have direct knowledge, it's much better than in papers,” said Neto Valente. "We have to account that the school is fulfilling the role that is expected to play," added the leader, recalling that the Portuguese State holds the majority of the capital of the EPM foundation. Still on the EPM universe, Miguel de Senna Fernandes, who also leads the Macanese Instruction Promoting Association (Apim), suggested a close look at the Chinese teaching in the EPM. "I have always advocated that Cantonese must have status. Because students, when they leave school, are in a singing world. This with all the merit that can have teaching in Mandarin," he said. "It is an issue that should be posed. It's a delicate question, because we are talking about an official language," he added, referring to Mandarin, an official language in China. The official, also vice president of the EPM foundation, admits that this is not a question that generates consensus -"many parents do not agree with this view" -but stresses that the learning of Cantonese "is a vehicle of integration", as it is the dominant language in the territory. Yes to the electronic vote Also to Lusa several associative leaders defended the transition to electronic vote, stressing embarrassment in the current options for emigration. "As long as it is not advanced without being tested, I am fully in agreement. The future is this and we have to point out," said the president of the CPM. In legislative elections, the Portuguese abroad have the possibility of exercising the right to vote in person or by post, while in presidential and European, the vote is in person. In choosing correspondence, the government sends the address indicated in the census notebook the voting report and two envelopes, one of green and one white, which must be returned to the Ministry of Internal Affairs after filling. The electronic option “can offer greater security”, defended Maria Amelia António. "With the consulates to work badly, in order to have few employees, with their work, and in countries where they are far from the places where people live, it is very difficult for people to vote personally. There has also been a lot of failures in the guarantees of receiving vote [via mail]," he added. The electronic choice is a longstanding claim of the Portuguese Communities Council (CCP). Rui Marcelo, president of the Regional Council of the Portuguese Communities of Asia and Oceania, who has a meeting scheduled with the Portuguese Foreign Minister, said that the “theme is already part of the CCP agenda“ a few years ago and has been approached several times and with several governments ”. "With the advancement of technology and the possibility of implementing security systems that can ensure vote safety - which happens today through the provision of services in other areas also the government - the conditions are created so that we can eventually evolve into a situation where it can obviously be a complement, but not a substitute," he noticed. In February, the Portuguese Parliament approved a resolution proposed by the PSD to test the electronic vote in emigration. The President of the Portuguese Republic, Marcelo Rebelo de Sousa, suggested in December, an electronic voting pilot experience in the circles of emigration. The head of Portuguese diplomacy arrives in Macau today after passing by Beijing and Haikou, in the province of Haimão, where he was present at the Boao Forum. In Macao, Paulo Rangel has scheduled meetings with the head of local government, Sam Hou Fai, as well as the counselors of the Portuguese communities, associative representatives, educational institutions and entrepreneurs.
