item.title: Apomac | Jorge Fão regrets lack of people to manage association
item.description:
APOMAC - Macao's retirees, retired and pensioners association goes to elections tomorrow with a unique list. Francisco Mannão competes again for president, Jorge Fão for the General Assembly and Daniel Mendonça to the Fiscal Council. Mannão suggests the creation of a “satellite city” only for the elderly and calls for pensions update
Increasing the elderly pensions would be "gold on blue." In the meantime, Francisco Mannão continues to fight for this and other flags designed to improve the lives of older residents, again leading the candidate list for the management of Apomac - Macao's retirees, retirees and pensioners association, which take place tomorrow. The list is unique and the faces have little or nothing difference from previous years: Jorge Fão continues to lead the General Assembly, while Daniel Mendonça competes for the Fiscal Council. There is only one new name in the position of Member of the Fiscal Council. "It is very difficult to find people available to do this volunteer work. Jorge and I would like to find someone who could replace us, because we are for a long time in this association. We are elderly, but we have energy. As long as we have strength on the legs to walk, we are walking and trying to do our best by Apomac," Francisco Mannhão told HM. Jorge Fão highlights the fact that Apomac has been about to celebrate 25 years since the foundation, noting that there is, in fact, a leadership problem that if not solved can culminate in the disappearance of the association. "We are not seeing the emergence of another list of younger and younger people, so that we offer our services for another term and so on, as far as possible. There is a leading problem at Apomac and in other associations. The Apomac issue is more serious, because we have been standing for 24 years, we will celebrate in May." Satellite city and pensions In a list that will lead the association by 2028, the motto is “we are elderly but energetic”, reads in the action program. At the first point, it is indicated that the team's objective is "to monitor the government's policy and the Macau Foundation, with a view to adjusting the needs of our action program throughout this three -year term." In addition, they intend to "provide the necessary support to members so that they can enjoy the benefits awarded by the Government of MSAR and other official entities." One of the requests on the list to the government led by Sam Hou Fai is the increase in pensions, which is currently 3,740 patacas. It would be for the association would be the update to four thousand monthly patacas. "It would be good for the government of MSar to pay the pension to the elderly monthly, the pecuniary compensation and the old age, instead of having to wait every three months to receive the pension for the elderly, seven months to receive the pecuniary compensation and ten months to receive the old age. Hm. Another idea left by Francisco Mannão is from the construction of a satellite city only for elderly dwellings, in what would be a larger project against residence for the elderly already built by the executive, in the area of ​​sand black. "I liked the Government of MSA to build a satellite city for the elderly. I worry a lot because there are many living alone, and with the construction of this satellite city they no longer have problems of loneliness, and could live with each other, and can provide services common to all. The construction of high buildings is good, but for the elderly it is not that good," he defended. Still, Mannão assures that being elderly in Macau is much easier than in Hong Kong. “Nowadays, in Macau, the elderly live quite well, because there are many social support attributed to this group of people. Sufficient resources Asked about the essential points to make Apomac a larger association, Francisco Mannhão says that “they have enough”, however, the closure of the clinic where they were provided to the elderly health care. "Of course we had the plan to be able to develop our headquarters more, but due to the lack of the allowance we had to end our clinic. In this context, we had a program to develop this area that had to be abandoned, and that would benefit our associates. We tried to organize more lectures about health, because the senior group needs to know more about disease and health affairs, something that can generate great concerns." In political terms, Francisco Mannhão, who was even a candidate for deputy to the Legislative Assembly, says that Apomac is an advocate of the principle of “one country, two systems”, thought by Beijing to the regions of Macau and Hong Kong. "We agree with the national policy of 'a country, two systems', so that Macau can be a paradise for us. So far we have been quite well in Macau, we have no problems, but we would like this principle to continue." A lot of bureaucracy One of the services provided by Apomac goes through bureaucratic support to the elderly in communication with the General Retirement Caixa (CGA), in the case of former civil servants who receive the reform of Portugal, or the Macao Pension Fund. "The communication with CGA has improved a little, but the bureaucratic part is still very difficult to deal with on the part of our associates. Not long ago one of our associates has waited more than three years for an amount of an amount that was improperly charged," said Francisco Mannão. Jorge Fão, in turn, stressed that Apomac is also popular with non -partners, including from the Chinese community, to treat various issues, such as requests for subsidies or funeral -related paperwork. Still looking at the Action program, Apomac's list also aims to “organize more sightseeing tours to mainland China, making known its culture and success of the country”, as well as the promotion of “more coexistence, so that members join periodically”. Much sought after by the dining service, since in Apomac some dishes of macanese gastronomy can be eaten, the list wants to "improve the management of the canteen whenever possible." Asked whether many elderly from Macao wishes, one day, to reform China, at a time when regional integration is increasingly a reality, Francisco Mannão admits yes, although many “prefer to stay in the territory, as they have their life rooted here, being used to the uses and customs of Macao”. "The Government of MSA has been doing a lot of work so that they can join the great bay," he said.

item.title: BOAO FORUM | Ia, globalization and sustainability in discussion
item.description:
Another edition of the Boao Forum began in Haião, where topics such as artificial intelligence, globalization, current economic issues and sustainable development will be discussed. The head of the Executive of Masters departs today for the event, whose theme is “Asia in the world in transformation: towards a shared future”
Posters to announce another edition of the Boao Forum can be seen everywhere in Haião, the Chinese island that hosts the International Forum promoted by Beijing to discuss, with other countries, issues of economic, commercial and cooperation at various levels. The MSAR will be represented by an official delegation led by Sam Hou Fai, chief executive, who will be on the island between today and tomorrow. Liu Xianfa, commissioner of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the People's Republic of China in the MSAR, continues to join the delegation of MSAR as a guest advisor. The official delegation of the MSAR is also composed by the secretary for the economy and finance, Tai Kin IP, and the chief executive chief of the cabinet, Chan Kak. During the absence of Sam Hou Fai, the Secretary for Administration and Justice, André Cheong, will interim the functions of Chief Executive. The Boa Goveal Forum for Asia 2025 ends on Friday and has as its theme “Asia in the world in transformation: Towards a shared future” [Asia in the Changing World: Tows a Shared Future], and, according to a statement released by the chief executive's office, focuses on four essential areas, one of them “rebuilding confidence and promoting cooperation in a rapid transformation world”. Objectives are followed by "encouraging growth and rebalanced globalization for inclusive development" or "modeling the future and rapidly implementing the objectives of sustainable development to respond more effectively to global challenges." In turn, the fourth objective concerns a very current area: Artificial Intelligence (AI). It is thus intended to “explore potentialities and intensify AI's application and governance for development motivated by innovation”. According to the People's Daily Journal, this year are expected for more than two thousand participants from 60 countries and regions, being held 50 forums, or discussion groups, around the above objectives. 1,140 journalists are expected to coverage the event. The forecasts of a forum The main conferences of the Boao Forum include discussions about the Chinese and World Economy, namely in "High-Level dialogue: China's reform and economic predictions" and "construction of an open world economy: challenges and solutions." Following is “Improvement of the construction of digital capacity & conforming the gap between digital”, as well as “unlock the great potential of regional free trade agreements”. Among the remaining panels are also conversations about the potential of AI in "AI: how to ensure a balance between application and governance." Countries will also address the issue of global governance in the relationship with the United Nations (UN), in "high-level dialogue: global governance after the UN summit of the future." But the discussion forums start with some predictions made in the report released in the context of the Boao Forum, entitled "Asian Economic Outlook and Integration Progress". One of the forecasts is that the Gross Domestic Product (GDP) of the Asian continent should grow 4.5 percent this year, reported Xinhua. "Despite growing global economic uncertainty, Asia remains a key growth engine for the world economy," the report says. In addition, in terms of parity of purchasing power, the Asia GDP ratio, within the world total, is expected to increase from a registration of 48.1 percent last year to 48.6 percent this year. In turn, the report describes that the general situation of employment and wages “is improving in Asia”, with an unemployment rate of 4.39 percent for this year, less than the global rate of 4.96 percent. The Asian Economic Outlook and Integration Progress also highlights foreign investments in Asia, describing that China and Asean-Association of Southeast Asia nations "are the most appealing economies in Asia." In addition, it refers that the dependence on the internal and external foreign direct and external investment of Asian economies in the region itself reached 49.15 percent by 2023. From the point of view of the bidirectional dependence of IDE in Asia, China continued to be the most dependent economy of the Asian IDE flows, followed by Indonesia, with its dependence rates over 80 percent and 75 percent, respectively. The report also pointed out that China remains the center of global production value chains, and since 2017, global trade in intermediate goods has been more dependent on China than in North America. In 2023, China's global dependence on intermediate goods was 16 percent compared to 15 percent to North America. The commercial friction caused by the United States in 2018 did not raise their position in the global value chains of the transforming industry, the report added. Thus, the advance of Asia is also described in the level of emerging green technologies, since this is "driven by strong industrial capabilities and political support." Thus, the continent seems to be positioning itself "as a potential leader in advanced materials related to batteries or production of biodegradable plastics." China, Japan, and the Republic of Korea dominate the Lithium Battery Battery Technology Global Supply Chain, a factor considered crucial for the electrification of transport, the report underlines. However, China is at the forefront of the expanding green hydrogen industry in Asia, being the region responsible for almost 70 percent of the worldwide capacity of hydrogen electrolisters, also reveals the same report. An ecological island According to an Xinhua report, Haião Island, which welcomes the Boao Forum, is “a pioneer in development with low carbon emissions”, namely the use of photovoltaic energy. "On Dongyu Island, in Hainan province, southern China, the almost null carbon emissions demonstration zone is redefining harmony between humanity and nature-remodeling modern life through the integration of cutting-edge technology with sustainable development," he describes. But there are more technological news, such as the use of "a simple QR code that unlocks a coffee carbon emissions experience, and where a robotic arm prepares coffee using clean energy." There is also the bet on recycling, as "an advanced recycling cube separates the materials, converting them into" carbon points ", which can be changed to ecological awards." The area that welcomes the Boao Forum has a total area of ​​190 hectares, where a bet on “three key strategies” was made, namely the “renewal of ecological buildings, use of renewable energy and ecological transport”. The renewal of the zone for more sustainable bets will have begun in 2022, being proof of “how technological innovation and urban renewal can shape a future with low carbon emissions, paving the way for sustainable development, particularly in the tropical regions of the world,” says Xinhua. Also according to the same report, "one of the main strengths of the area lies in energy production capacity", currently producing "about 32 million kWh of green electricity, almost double its search for 17 million kWh". In turn, "surplus energy is introduced into the network, contributing to an annual savings of 7 720 tons of negative carbon resources," he said to Xinhua Ouyang Qinglun, deputy director of the Cosco Shipping Boao Co. item.title: Domestic Violence | Ho Ion Sang asks resources to help victims
item.description:
Despite the “success” of domestic violence policies, the residents' deputy considers that local associations must have more means to support victims and their children. In addition to subsistence means, Ho Ion Sang highlights the importance of planning professional career and providing child care
Ho Ion Sang advocates the reinforcement of cooperation between the government and local associations to provide victims of domestic violence with more subsistence means. The subject is addressed through a interpelation written by the residents' deputy, in which greater cooperation between the government and local associations is requested. In the document, Ho advocates the reinforcement of the “social assistance network” and the improvement of “support for the level of subsistence means of domestic violence and children”, which involves not only the availability of financial support, but also by “more oriented and diverse services, such as career planning, vocational training and child care”. According to the deputy, in the current context, associations should assume a key role in helping victims in life after episodes of domestic violence, in cases where they need a network of support to rebuild their lives. Ho Ion Sang is a deputy for the residents' association, one of the most supported by the government with public funds. More cooperation The reinforcement of cooperation between local associations and the government is not only intended to request more resources. Ho Ion Sang asks for the development of guidelines, promised by the executive for this year, who will define ways to deal with cases of domestic violence when there are children involved. In the questions sent to the government, the deputy recalls that the guidelines were completed in 2023, and that last year the authorities heard public services and associations. However, the executive's goal was to publicize and implement the guidelines throughout this year, without more information so far. Therefore, the deputy asks the government to reveal the calendar when they will be presented. In written interplies, the deputy also considers that “cooperation with non -governmental organizations and consolidate resources from all parties involved” to “create a favorable atmosphere for the whole community to oppose and unanimously resist domestic violence”. Regarding prevention, Ho Ion Sang praises the work carried out, with the approval of the legislation that made this a public crime, which has led to a gradual reduction of occurrences. However, it asks the executive not to make it easier for the efforts to combat crime to alert the population more to this phenomenon.

item.title: PCC | Patriotic Education of the Hand
item.description:
The Secretary for Social Affairs and Culture went to Beijing where she met with leaders of the central government and the Communist Party of China, from whom she heard compliments regarding patriotic education in the MSAR. Deputy Minister Wu Yan advised national integration to the universities of Macau
A delegation led by the Secretary for Social Affairs and Culture, LAM, which included the director of Youth Education and Development Services, Kong Chi Meng and the president of the Cultural Institute, Deland Leong Wai Man, went to Beijing to meet with leaders of the Communist Party of China and the central government. Although the trip took place between March 29 and April 1, it was only released by O Lam's office on Tuesday night. The MSar leaders' entourage visited the Communication Department of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China (CCP), the Central Government Ministry of Education, the China Communist Party Museum and the National Center for Performative Arts. On the morning of March 31, the Entourage of the MSAR met with Hu Hing, responsible for the daily work of the Communication Department of the CCP Central Committee. The leader highlighted "Macao's notable progress in patriotic education, reaffirming the continuous support of the CCP's Central Committee Department of Macao Cultural Industry. In addition, he defended the strengthening of cooperation between the Department and the Government of Masters to promote" the beautiful traditions of love for the homeland and Macau ". Hu Hipão highlighted the advantages of the rapport of Chinese and Western cultures of Macao, to promote the exchange and learning between civilizations and the sociocultural integration of Macao in the global conjuncture of the country's development. Learn to be happy The MSAR leaders were also received, Deputy Minister Wu Yan, who "expressed their support for the development of Macau education and expressed their hope that Macau can contribute to the integration of education, science and technology and qualified staff in the country." The Chinese ruler also hopes that Macao's higher education institutions adopt “a high quality development” to “operate with high accuracy and integrate into the general conjuncture of the country's development”. The delegation also visited the Communist Party Museum of China and the National Center for Performative Arts, "where the magnificent history of the Communist Party of China in its 100 years of struggle, as well as the important cultural facilities in the country, became known. MSAR leaders have indicated that they want to organize visits by "teachers and students from Macao, a loan of important historical collections to Macau for exhibition and the organization of thematic seminars."

item.title: Caeal | Requested exemption from schools during electoral act
item.description: The Commission on Electoral Affairs of the Legislative Assembly (Caeal) has organized a session with various educational institutions to remember the need for schools to respect the “principles of justice, impartiality and integrity in the elections”. The initiative was invited by the Directorate of Youth Education and Development Services (DSEDJ). With several schools linked to government -funded associations that present candidate lists for elections, cases of election campaign through students, as with the delivery of leaflets, are not uncommon. For this reason, Caeal highlighted the need for the directions to ensure that schools remain on the sidelines of the electoral act. The chairman of the committee, Judge Seng Ioi Man, stressed in the session that "public schools must maintain a neutral position, and that their employees should also maintain a neutral position before the various application lists, during the execution of their tasks, not being able to proceed electoral advertising during the time or working space." Regarding private schools, the official argued that “electoral law does not specifically regulate private schools in the field of electoral propaganda”, but that internal guidelines “must be decided and applied by the private schools themselves, but always in accordance with the law and carried out within the period of electoral propaganda”.

item.title: Housing | Request support for those in the waiting list
item.description:
In the middle of the electoral pre-campaign, Nick Lei has insisted on the subject of housing. The deputy released yesterday a written interpellation where he asks for the return of the allowance for those who wait for a social housing fraction, and the reduction of waiting time for the delivery of a home
For more than three months from the beginning of the campaign for the next elections that will select the future cast of the Legislative Assembly, Nick Lei seems to have chosen one of his priorities: public housing. After on Monday, the deputy linked to the Fujian community released a response from the Housing Institute to a written interpellation on economic housing, yesterday was the turn to address social housing. Nick Law insists on the return of the subsidy to help pay the income to candidates waiting for a fraction. The so -called “residence allowance” was created in the second term of Edmund Ho in the government leadership, to help families who met the access criteria for a social housing, but who were on the waiting list, because there is no available apartments. In the last round of the support, in 2022, the amount of the subsidy was 1,650 patacas per month, for aggregates with one or two members, and 2,500 patacas per month, for household aggregates with more than two people. The deputy acknowledges that in the near future, the supply of social housing may satisfy the demand. But for now, there are those who have been waiting for a fraction for over two and a half years. "It should be noted that families who expect social housing are all composed of economically disadvantaged residents. Although the government has ensured that the waiting for a fraction was reduced to a year after the implementation of the permanent candidacy mechanism, this continues not to reflect real wait between the various types of apartment typology," said the deputy.
More worthwhile Nick Law sets the example of the social housing apartment candidates, which largely exceed the offer. But it admits that the blocks of this type of public housing in zone A of new landfills, which must be completed between 2026 and 2027, can help solve the situation by offering about 4,088 apartments, of which 3,276 are T1. In addition, also the Avenida Venceslau de Morais Social Housing Complex, the Mong Son Building will help to bridge the gaps on the side of the offer. This building consists of three blocks, with 24 to 35 floors, three floors in a basement, providing 885 T1 typology fractions and 705 T2 typology fractions, totaling 1,590 social housing fractions. The deputy argues that the financial pressure caused by the lease market seriously affects the poorest families, especially compared to the annual rise of 3.9 percent of the income averages last year. Another of the deputy's demands is the maximum guarantee that the government gave four years, between the moment a social housing candidacy is accepted and the delivery of a home. Nick Law would like this warranty period to be reduced.

item.title: The psychology of attraction at first sight
item.description: "Attraction at first sight" is a phenomenon that fascinates everyone. The romantic comedies portray her as an instant and uncontrollable moment between two people. It is now necessary to unravel the possible explanations behind this phenomenon, resorting to two major schools of thought: cognitive psychology-which develops empirical methodologies to test hypotheses on the subject-and the psychodynamic approach-that works with interpretative bases. Both perspectives build metaphors that help us interpret these processes. Thus, we can oscillate between two proposals: will at first glance be a product of deeply rooted unconscious mechanisms or, on the contrary, a posteriori romantic construction, based on sensory and cognitive processes? Cognitive psychology suggests that "attraction at first sight" can result from rapid processing of sensory and emotional information. The human brain is programmed to recognize standards and categorize information efficiently, allowing us to evaluate someone in fractions of second, based on facial traits, expressions or body language. Studies on social perception confirm that we formulate immediate judgments about others. From a biological point of view, this phenomenon may be linked to activation of the dopaminergic system, responsible for the regulation of pleasure and reward. When we find someone we consider attractive, the brain releases dopamine, triggering a desire for proximity. In addition, investigation into pheromonas indicate that we are unconsciously attracted by partners whose immune system complements ours, favoring genetic diversity in descent. On the other hand, the psychodynamic approach, rooted in Sigmund Freud's psychoanalysis, explains the attraction at first sight through unconscious mechanisms. From this perspective, past experiences - especially those of childhood - shape our standards of attraction. When we feel instantly attracted to someone, it may be because this person acts memories or emotions associated with primary linking figures such as parents or caregivers. Attraction does not focus on the other as a real person, but in the way he resonates within our unconscious structure of desire. The other can symbolize something we lack, something interdict or an emotional issue not yet resolved. This mechanism, known as projective identification, explains how we can feel a strong attraction to someone who unconsciously represents significant parts of our psychic history. According to this theory, we rarely fall in love with those who really are, but by the way we project in it our unresolved emotional needs. The attraction is therefore a meeting of unconscious, where both project family standards in each other. Of course beliefs also shape romantic expectations. If we believe that instant attraction is a sign of destination, we tend to attribute to it emotional meaning. The impact of culture and social norms shows how the perception of “love at first sight” can be influenced by romanticed narratives. For example, in books, movies or advertising romanticizes the idea of ​​attraction at first glance, creating a narrative that leads people to idealize and expect intense and immediate emotional links. This cultural expectation can influence the way we interpret real encounters-if someone lives in tune with romantic ideals, it is more likely to attribute emotional meaning to an instant attraction, facing it as something "intended to happen" or "predestined". Cognitive psychology faces the phenomenon more pragmatically, almost stripping it of its romanticism: it all depends on our mental processing and what we consider relevant. Psychoanalysis, on the other hand, articulates the cross between fantasy and reality, proposing that although the attraction at first glance is composed of projective and fanciful elements, they are not totally dissociated from the meeting itself. There is something significant in this dynamic; Otherwise, people would not fall in love. As a psychoanalyst would say, we are attracted to those who can nourish our psychic wounds-which later may reveal the cause of dysfunctions in the couple. There is an intangible domain that subtly communicates who we are, where we have come from and how we can complete. In short, while neuroscience and cognitive psychology highlight automatic and hormonal reactions, psychodynamics emphasizes the role of unconscious and past experiences. Although cognitive and psychodynamic psychology can seem opposite-one focusing on conscious and observable processes and the other in unconscious and emotional mechanisms-there is potential for overlap, and recognizing it could make explanation more robust. The cognitive perspective on attraction, which emphasizes rapid and automatic judgments based on physical signals and emotional responses, can be understood as the initial and superficial processing that is complemented by unconscious processes. But my proposal is another: show that the way we look at the phenomenon affects the way we live it. Each explanation can better adapt to each person's experiences. Is the attraction at first glance rooted in an authentic and deep desire, or is it an illusion fueled by the human need for connection and meaning? The answer may reside in each other's imagination and wealth. Ultimately, the way we interpret the phenomenon of “attraction at first sight” can be deeply influenced by the brain and unconscious mechanisms discussed, but also by the cultural narratives we internalize. Thus, experience will always be an intersection between what we feel and how we learn to feel.

item.title: Hong Kong International Academy Against Corruption (II)
item.description: Last week, we debated the Independent Commission Against Corruption of Hong Kong (HKICAC) (Hong Kong Against Corruption Committee) and Hong Kong International Academy Against Corruption (HKIAAC) (HGO KONG ACADEMY AGAINST CORRUPTION) and we introduced their origins succinctly. Macao Commissioner against Corruption, (CCAC). In 1975, during the Portuguese administration of Macao, the fight against corruption was carried out by the Judicial Police. In 1992, the then government of Macao created the High Commissioner against corruption and administrative illegality. Referring to Hong Kong's experience, which had become one of the most impollowing places in the world, when writing Macau's Basic Law, it was clearly stipulated that CCAC would have to be created. The CCAC website underlines the committed work it develops to review the law and strengthen the fight against corruption. One of the most illustrative cases is that of Man Long: “Investigating the case of corruption A to Man Long began in 2005, when during the investigation of a corruption case based on information available in the meantime, CCAC found that the then secretary for transport and public works was involved in suspicion of abuse of power. He will have accepted bribes of large construction entrepreneurs and the winners of major government works are indicated.” (In April 2007, the first phase of the inquiry against Man Long was completed. This shows that CCAC has achieved extraordinary results in its work to combat corruption. In 2006, the International Association of Anti-Corruption Authorities (Iaaca) was created in Beijing. It is the first international anti-corruption organization in the world with agencies from various member countries. It aims to actively promote the “United Nations Convention against Corruption” and reinforce international cooperation between counterparts from various countries. Cao Jianming, Attorney General of China's Supreme Popular Attorney's Office, was elected president of IAACA twice, on November 5, 2010 and November 24, 2013. The mandate of the IAACA President is three years. On January 5, 2022, the Commission Commission Commission against Hong Kong Corruption, Ba Yunliu, was elected as a new president. Later, Ba Yunliu retired. On September 1, 2023, Hu Yingming assumed the position of president of IAACA. IAACA has a “Federation Secretariat”, created by HKICAC on January 6, 2022 to support the HKICAC Commissioner in the exercise of his duties as president of IAACA. The main responsibility of the Federation Secretariat is to support or organize activities. HKIAAC is affiliated with the HKICAC International Cooperation and Institutional Affairs Division and performs part of the federation secretariat's duties. Hong Kong Chief Executive John Lee believes that, in addition to cooperating with China's work and anti-corruption policies, HKICAC also cooperates with organizations around the world to jointly promote the global anti-corruption cause. HKICAC can help improve the fight against corruption in Hong Kong, promote the region's unpolluted environment and promote the stability, integrity and rule of law of Hong Kong society. Currently, HKICAC has already trained in over 70 countries. In February 2024, HKICAC coorganized a “International Anti-Corruption Course on Financial Investigation and Pursuit of Fugitives and Stolen Assets”, lasting nine days, in collaboration with the “Operational Network of Agencies for the Anti-Corruption Law of the United Nations Drug and Crime Law”. In March 2024, HKICAC opened a five-day anti-corruption course for more than 90 employees from the “illegal enrichment office” in Mali, covering topics such as research techniques, integrity management and public education. In early April 2024, HKICAC sent staff to Kazakhstan in Central Asia to conduct courses to nearly 200 local anti-corruption agencies. In May 2024, HKICAC signed a memo of cooperation with the United Nations and Crime Operational Network of Application Agencies. In May 2025, it assisted it in the writing of the “Prison Corruption Risk Management Guidelines”. A HKICAC spokesman pointed out: “HKICAC values ​​the operability that combines theory with practice, actively fulfills its anti-corruption mission, build an international platform for integrity, promote the development of the anti-corruption cause globally, and unequivocally contributes to its advancement worldwide.” HKICAC has provided several anti-corruption formations in many countries and worked hard to combat global corruption. These achievements were made under the leadership of China. From now on, HKICAC will not only continue to compete with this work, but its existence will speak for the history of China and Hong Kong. Gafi (FATF) is the worldwide organization responsible for setting international policies and standards in combating capital bleaching, financing terrorism and proliferation of weapons of massive destruction, and the occurrence of other threats to the integrity of the world financial system. Years of Analysis As a legal consultant in international law, the author has witnessed over two decades “gradual metamorphosis, which began to be a specialized technical organism, for a complex and multifaceted organization, whose legitimacy is impaired by the lack of clarity as to its legal position”. The scope of the organization, and the long -reaching impact of its policies and measures, to respond to global trends and threats that pose a risk to the international financial system, as well as how members, non -members, international organizations and other interveners have accepted and implemented them, without a thorough examination (weights and counterweights) and without questioning their legal status, is the reflection that is placed. item.title: Peter Kogler, artist: “The visual language I use is universal”
item.description:
Peter Kogler is the artist chosen for a new showcase in the design and architecture studio Impromptu Projects, by Rita Machado and João Ó, inaugurated tomorrow. Until December 31 this year it will be possible to see, in “Peter Kogler: Showroom”, at Travessa de Inácio Baptista, the works of this international artist who innovated by gluing the world of technology and computers to art, creating a new artistic language
How do you feel about presenting your work in Macau? Unfortunately I was never in Macau. I was contacted about two or three years ago by Rita and João [Rita Machado and João Ó] to participate in a project, I saw the things they were developing, and that seemed very interesting to me. We had a conversation and from then on we knew that there was a hypothesis of doing a joint project in the future. But only now can we realize it. What kind of jobs does this shower bring? It is an interesting façade with a mosaic, where there is a showcase and we did a wallpaper installation, which is a kind of façade continuity, as if it were a distorted grid. We have after the LED fans with two globes that run in all directions in a chaotic way. It is a kind of street exhibition because it is in a showcase. Is it to you a different way of presenting your work with the public? I have already exposed in various museums and spaces, and exposed in a more classic way, so to say, with exhibitions. But I also did a lot of projects in the so -called public space, such as metro or train stations. That's why I'm now in Naples, because I'm working on a project for a huge metro station in partnership with an architect. As an artist, how do you feel more comfortable showing your work? In a museum, or in a public space? I like to work in both ways. It must be borne in mind that when you do a project in public space, people have no choice. They have to cross a metro station or a train station [and see the exposed project]. But when you go to a gallery or museum, it's a conscious decision of someone who knows he will confront the art exposed there. This is the main difference. Therefore, we have a different audience when we work in a public space, and we have to adjust our visual language to a specific situation. It is considered one of the pioneers of computational art and the integration of a digital environment in art. How did you decide that this was the way to follow as an artist? When I was just a young artist in 1984, I went to an office machines fair in Vienna. I remember when Apple's Macintosh was presented, the first computer that had an icon-based user interface, in graphic information. It was thus the first machine in which the user did not have to have any kind of programming about programming, one could use Macintosh quite intuitively. This was, of course, a paradigmatic change, and it was evident that it would change the way images are produced and how they are communicated. This was one of the aspects that influenced me. Another has to do with the fact that, in art history, computers have no presence at that time, that is, there was not much to do at that time, so the opportunity to create a kind of new visual language was quite good. These were the two main reasons that led me to choose this means as my main tool. Actualmente, com a Inteligência Artificial (IA), há todo um novo universo que pode ser explorado artisticamente. Well, I believe it will change our lives at various levels, it will affect the entire social context. The internet was, by itself, a big change, and social networks also came to change a lot. AI is not just something with an impact on art, but in our entire lives. What kind of messages are transmitted with your work? There is no specific type of message, I would say. When we work with computers and use them as a visual tool we are linked to all other domains where this type of digital media plays a role. Therefore, it is an area that tells us something about a particular situation at a certain historical moment.
What expectations do you have about the reception of your work in Macau? And what influence can the territory bring to your work? I start by saying that the visual language I use in my work has a very universal character. I work with some elements that can be read in any type of culture, such as the brain, the hands, the globe, tubes. All of these images do not have any kind of specific cultural connotation. I look forward to going to Macau so that I can realize the specific qualities of the territory. I assume that Macao is the result of a very complex situation due to historical circumstances, with the fact that it was a Portuguese colony with China which, at this moment, presents a powerful economic context. There are many influences that intersect there. Throughout his career he has exposed in the main museums and galleries around the world. Did you expect this international recognition? Above all, I think it is a privilege to have the possibility of working at so many different levels and with so many different cultural contexts. It is also a continuous process of learning. Your work is very close to the abstract universe. How do you feel if the public does not understand what they want to convey, or even with negative criticism? Of course I am not happy, but this is part of the work. You know, there are always different opinions, and that's how things are. But do you understand that your work can focus on the abstract level, or am I doing a wrong analysis? There are in fact certain elements in my visual language that present themselves with a kind of abstract tradition. But there are also many elements with connection to things we know, such as the brain or the globe. My work also communicates at different levels, but there are also more direct things, such as the facilities I do most directed to children, for example. Then the children react strongly. This means that information goes quite directly, because it is not something that can be said or explain to them, because children do not exactly have knowledge of art history. What are the great influences on your art? Have these influences change over time? An important aspect is what you can do with technology. I started working with computers in 1984, where there were graphic programs with a specific visual language. But there were very few devices to transfer the elements to other materials, such as screens or wallpapers. Therefore, they were fully analog transfer and production processes, at the level of photography or screen printing, for example. Throughout all these years technology has developed quickly and today any type of element transfer or production is digital, such as projecting computer animations, printing things for facades… It was important to observe all these technical possibilities and understand how I can use them and include in my visual language.

Regarding fruits, the representative points out that the large majority is bought from suppliers from the interior of China. For now, the containers who were loaded before April 5 and those already on the route to Hong Kong were only subject to a rate of 10 percent. However, IP Sio Man confessed to being difficult to predict what will happen to commercial connections with the US and prices when the load ships already arrive with charged products, something that should happen at the end of next month. Route problems The president of the Suppliers Association has an optimistic view of the commercial landscape, arguing that the countries and neighboring regions, especially from Southeast Asia, can look for low -tax markets such as Hong Kong and Macau to export their products and that this competition can lead to pricing down. In addition to Trump's fares, IP Sio Man stressed the instability that has severely cut off maritime transport in the Red Sea, due to Israel and US offensive in Yemen and the attacks of the Huti rebels, which have attacked load ships. This situation affected the trade of goods from Portugal, with the sale of products such as olive oil, which took two months, twice the time, to circumvent the conflict zone. The main impact was felt at the level of fresh short products, such as cheeses, dairy products and premium meats, which became more expensive. HM spoke to a Portuguese businessman who imports Portuguese products and who, due to delays in maritime transport, began to choose the airway. Despite the increase in transportation costs, Stock management forced looking for alternatives to the sea route, which takes three months to turn on Portugal to Macau.

item.title: Satellite casinos | SME admit agony with closures
item.description:
Several entrepreneurs from small and medium-sized companies have admitted that with the end of the satellite casinos will have to close their business or move on to mass discharge
Dependent companies or with great revenues generated by the satellite casinos recognize that they are very concerned about the prospects of a closing wave at the end of the year. The position of several entrepreneurs was taken in statements to the newspaper or Mun. Satellite casinos result from agreements between some independent dealers and companies, which explore various game spaces, as with Kam Pek or Bridge 16 casinos, a total of 11 casinos. In this model, the independent companies exploit casinos, but with workers, game tables and chips of the dealers, with whom they have an agreement and who make payments. The last review of the game law established a period of three years to end this model, which ends later this year. As a result, dealers may choose to assume, by themselves, the exploration of these casinos or close the spaces. Speaking to the newspaper or Mun, a resident with the nickname Lam, who is responsible for a software company, said half of the company's revenues derive from one of the satellite casinos. Without these revenues, the leader admits that the company will start losing money and that in this scenario there are only two hypotheses: paying the losses with money from their pocket, until the situation becomes unsustainable, or doing what nicknamed “cutting an arm”, the dismissal of about 30 to 40 percent of workers. Lam also said that satellite casinos distribute a lot of money to small and medium enterprises by hiring services. However, if only the dealership survives, the local economy will feel an impact it has classified as deep. Another businessman, with the nickname Sin, responsible for a cleaning company, traveled a similar scenario, and acknowledged that with the closure of the satellite casinos will say goodbye to the total of the total staff, which indicated to represent about 100 workers, due to lack of work. Less transportation The need to move forward with the dismissal of workers is also the scenario before Choi, according to the newspaper or Mun. The entrepreneur of a private personnel transport company said that it currently survives in the local market due to services rendered to the satellite casinos. Choi acknowledged that 80 percent of the recipes come from these spaces and that in case of closing this volume of business will not be replaced. The businessman indicated that although Macau receives more tourists these have a very different profile. Among the differences, he pointed out that they are younger and do not move through this type of transport, first resorting to public transport. The newspaper or Mun also spoke to another IP businessman, responsible for an advertising lighting product company. It employs between 20 and 30 workers and most services are provided to the satellite casinos. If they end, IP indicates that not only will your company close, as well as several other stores in the vicinity of casinos and depend on them.

item.title: Fires | Minus 15 percent occurrences
item.description:
In the first three months of the year there was a general decrease in the occurrences that implied the intervention of the Fire Department. Still, the authorities were called to intervene in 13,207 cases
In the first three months of the year the number of fires recorded by the Fire Department (CB) presented a 15.35 percent reduction with 215 occurrences compared to the same period. The first quarter figures of the year were presented yesterday at a press conference. According to official data, between January and March this year there were fewer fires compared to the same period, when the number of fires had been 254 occurrences. Among the 215 fires, 155 were extinguished without resorting to the use of hoses. Last year, the number of fire extinguished without the need to turn on the hoses had been 204. Regarding the fires of the first months of this year, 35 fireworks were due to situations of burnt food. Last year, this type of occurrences had contributed to 61 cases. Among the other causes of fire occurrences are the oblivion of linked stoves, flames that are not fully extinguished, burning incense, candles and votive papers, short circuits in electrical installations and mechanical failures. Despite the reduction of fires, in the first half were several occurrences in residential buildings that caused at least five injured. The numbers show that the general general of occurrences in which the Fire Department had to intervene presented a 6.32 percent reduction from 14,098 cases to 13,207 cases. Less ambulances Regarding data on ambulance exits there was a reduction in cases of 3.1 percent to 11,406 occurrences, which required the use of 12,221 vehicles, a reduction of 3.43 percent. In the same period, 11,774 occurrences were registered that required the departure of 12,655 emergency vehicles. About this difference, the Fire Department indicated that it was due to "mainly reducing cases of mild fever indisposition and breathing difficulties." "The general cases of relief dealt essentially with dizziness, abdominal pain, breathing difficulties, vomiting, fevers and various types of injuries," he was added. Also in rescue operations there was a reduction of 3.3 percent, from 454 cases to 439 cases. Finally, with regard to special services, a reduction of 29.01 percent, from 1,616 cases to 1,144 cases, a difference of 29.21 percent was found.

item.title: AMCM | Securities Deposit and Settlement Center loses 7.18 million
item.description:
The Macao Securities Deposit and Settlement Center, controlled 100 percent by MSAR, continues to record successive losses. Since 2022, the company created to diversify the economy of Macau has never presented profits
Macao's central deposit and settlement company (MCSD) registered losses of 7.18 million patacas last year. This is the second consecutive year with loss of the company controlled 100 percent by the Monetary Authority of Macau (AMCM), which had presented losses of 6.7 million patacas in the previous year. Created in 2021, MCSD emerged within the policy of the Ho IAT SENG government to diversify the economy in the field of finance and has as its functions the exploitation of financial infrastructure, central registration services, compensation, settlement and deposit of securities. Within these functions, MCSD has been supporting the obligation to be borrowed. However, the company's numbers insist on continuing to have damage. In the first full year of operations in 2022, the company that has a corporate capital of 50 million Patacas, had losses of 3.9 million patacas. The following year, the damage rose to 6.7 million patacas and the latest data show a new negative record of 7.18 million patacas. More revenues and expenses Despite the negative scenario, revenues originated by contracts with participants in the financial market of Macau even registered an increase. Currently, on the MCSD portal, about 90 entities appear as “participants”. In 2024, revenues derived from participation contracts rose to 2.9 million patacas, when the previous year had been about 966,000 patacas. In terms of the remaining revenues of last year, a 1 million patacas was calculated in interest, with the other services generated 11,300 patacas and the shift gains generating 721 patacas. In terms of expenses there was also an increase to 11.2 million patacas by 2024, compared to 9.2 million patacas of 2023. The highest cost was for the remuneration of workers from 3.1 million patacas to 4.6 million patacas. For this increase contributed the recruitment of five employees, totaling 13 workers at the end of 2024. The other major expense was due to pay the telecommunications post services that was 3.2 million patacas, below the cost of 3.3 million from the previous year.

item.title: Commerce | Suppliers ask for autonomy to American products
item.description: To avoid the impact of US tariffs, the Macao suppliers' union association advocates greater gradual autonomy from imported products in America. The idea came from the association's president, IP Sio Man, according to the Chinese channel of Radio Macau. According to IP, US dependence is negative because tariff policies are unpredictable and are constantly changing. The official indicated that last year, the value of products Macau exported to the US was 300 million patacas, while the value of imported products from the US was 70 billion patacas. On the other hand, IP Sio Man anticipated that the Macao government is unable to follow the interior in adopting retaliation policies against the US, so it should follow an alternative path. But even though Macau follows the background policy, IP has devalued the case, considering that it will not have great impact, because in recent years, Macau has actively explored new markets and can import products from other regions to replace those of the US.

Buddhism has introduced compassion and Christianity to Caritas, trying to break with this logic, but in many other beliefs and religions the cage of causalities prevails over sensitivity to experience, the need to respond to the now. It is a tremendous logic that transforms the world into a platonic stage, where we are just the shadows of something -an inextricable law -in a determinism that calcines all singularities, but strangely fascinates many. My friend will know how to combine her holistic and transpersonal belief with the freedom and responsibility that every moment asks us - but how many will make the destruction, under a law that explains and encompasses everything? item.title: Timor-Leste | Dili receives interministerial meeting of G7+
item.description: The capital of Timor-Leste will receive tomorrow and Saturday the sixth ministerial meeting of the G7+ that will first join the heads of the organization's diplomacy, which marks 15 years of existence. G7+ is a forum in which member countries seek to influence global discourse on peace, stability and resilience, as well as define joint actions to achieve those objectives. The Intergovernmental Organization was established on April 10, 2010, in Dili, and emerged with concern, shared by its Member States, that traditional development cooperation did not improve the situation of fragile nations. "The purpose of this meeting, the sixth G7+ministerial meeting, is to reflect on the progress achieved during the 15th anniversary of its establishment," said G7+Secretary-General, Helder da Costa. The meeting, which traditionally brings together the ministers of the finance, planning or economy of the Member States, will first join the heads of diplomacy in several countries because of “global politics”, to make a “reflection on the script for the coming years” and because G7+ has an “increasingly global voice”, said Helder da Costa. The meeting, co-organized with the Timorese Foreign Ministry, begins exactly with an intervention by Timorese Prime Minister Xanana Gusmão about “safeguarding peace in turbulent times: the vision of G7+”. The meeting will also make a presentation on the organization's path over the last 15 years and a debate on cooperation between the Member States. The G7+ has a Observer Statute to the UN General Assembly since December 2019 and in the community of Portuguese-speaking countries since July 2021. item.title: Tariffs | Japan says negotiations with USA include exchange rates
item.description: Japanese finance minister Katsunobu Kato yesterday indicated that the exchange rate between the dollar and the yen will be on the table in negotiations with the United States about tariffs. Kato has confirmed what analysts have been suggesting, based on the priority objective of the United States to reduce trade balance with countries with which they have deficit and to which tariffs -which he calls reciprocal -like Japan. "There have been several communications with the American side, including over exchange rates, and then movements in the exchange markets may be among the topics discussed, although the details have not yet been determined," Kato said in a speech in the Japanese parliament. The leader also explained that discussions about the exchange rate will be held among the finance ministers of both countries. The Japanese government announced on Tuesday that the minister responsible for economic revitalization and new capitalism, Ryosi Akazawa, will be Tokyo's main representative in tariff negotiations. Washington, in turn, appointed the duo graduated by Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent and commercial representative Jamieson Greer to lead the team.

item.title: Visit | Praised Spain's role in the approach of China to the EU
item.description: China yesterday highlighted the positive role Spain is playing in improving Beijing and the European Union, in a context of growing commercial tensions between China and the United States. "The ties between China and Spain maintain strategic stability and are based on the opening, cooperation and mutual benefit," said Foreign Ministry spokesman Lin Jian yesterday at a press conference in Beijing, where the head of the Spanish government, Pedro Sánchez, has planned to start an official visit tomorrow. The spokesman for the Ministry of Foreign Affairs has described Spain as "an important European economy and a fundamental cooperation partner within the European Union." The trip takes place in a period of climbing the trade war between China and the United States and after the Chinese Prime Minister, Li Qiang, spoke to the president of the European Commission, Ursula von der Leyen. The two leaders committed to defending free trade and reinforcing the role of the World Trade Organization (WTO). Sánchez will be received in Beijing by Chinese President Xi Jinping and will have meetings with the Prime Minister, Li Qiang, to diversify export markets, reinforce economic ties with Asia and face global challenges such as climate change and war in Ukraine.

item.title: EU | Chamber of Commerce in China says companies should rethink strategies
item.description: The European Union Chamber of Commerce in China said yesterday that the customs of 104 percent imposed by the United States on Chinese products "require a strategic rethink of business models and supply chains." The institution said in a statement that the fees will lead to “substantial increases in operating costs” and “inefficiencies”, which ultimately will mean “higher prices for consumers”. Many of the companies that are members of the House have already changed or are changing their trade strategies to a “China for China” model. "This is both to mitigate the risks arising from commercial tensions and to meet China's regulatory and acquisition requirements, which increasingly promote" Made in China "products as for commercial reasons," the text added. According to the institution, in a context where the United States are "retreating in many of the principles that have sustained its global commercial approach, generating unprecedented global economic uncertainty," China now has "the opportunity to establish a business environment that provides the stability and reliability that investors need."

item.title: Tariffs | Xi Jinping defends reinforcement of ties with neighbors
item.description: Chinese President Xi Jinping yesterday appealed to the “reinforcement of strategic ties with neighboring countries” in his first public appearance since Donald Trump increased to 104 percent customs at China. XI, who did not mention the US President, urged his employees during a working meeting to improve relationships with neighboring countries “through proper management of differences”, with a view to “reinforcing ties in supply chains,” said the official news agency Xinhua. China's relationships with neighboring countries are “at their best level in modern history” and at the same time Beijing is “in a crucial phase deeply interconnected with changes in regional dynamics and global developments,” he noted. The Chinese leader argued that China's diplomacy with his neighbors will be based on the construction of a “shared community”, one of the most repeated phrases by Chinese Communist Party leaders (CCP) in which it is argued that prosperity is only sustainable if nations work together. At the meeting, it was also stressed that China should reinforce its sense of responsibility and maintain a “neighboring, sincerity, mutual benefit and inclusion. Difference management It has also been underlined that China should "support countries in the region to maintain their own development pathways and correctly manage conflicts and differences." "We must build a high -level interconnection network and reinforce cooperation in industrial and supply chains," added the Chinese leader, stressing the importance of "maintaining regional stability and cooperating in matters and law enforcement." The Chinese leader has not made any reference to the United States and Beijing has been underlining so far that he will not give in to Trump's rates. Trump ordered on Tuesday the application of an additional 50 percent rate on Chinese products, raising total customs rates to 104 percent. Beijing previously announced a 34 percent rate on US products, after Trump imposed a rate in the same percentage on Chinese products, and announced yesterday an increase of 50 percent at the imposed rate, now totaling an 84 percent tariff. In the possible future negotiations between Beijing and Washington is also the future of Tiktok's application operations in the US, which Trump's government has demanded that it disconnect from its mother company, Chinese Bytedance, to be able to operate in US territory. Plus 50 percent China announced yesterday an additional 50 percent retaliation rate on imports from the United States to 84 percent, intensifying the trade war between the two largest economies in the world. The Chinese Ministry of Finance said the new rates apply beyond the 34 percent previously announced on US imports. The rates come in today.

item.title: China with nothing to lose if rates increase another 50 percent, economists say
item.description: Beijing is approaching a point where there is nothing to be losing in the trade war with Washington, economists said after US President Donald Trump threatened to increase rates by another 50 percent over Chinese products. “The profit margin of the Chinese export sector is between 30 percent and 40 percent,” wrote Dan Wang, director for China of the reflection group ('Think Tank') Eurasia Group. "If the United States impose customs rates more than 35 percent, most of its profits will be eliminated. The fact that the rates are 70 percent or even 1000 percent makes no big difference, as it prevents China from negotiating directly with the United States," he argued. Since his inauguration in January, Trump has applied an additional 20 percent overflow on Chinese products entering the United States. This surcharge should increase to 54 percent tomorrow. In response, Beijing has announced that it will impose 34 percent rates on US products from Thursday. The president of the United States threatened on Monday to increase rates by another 50 percent if Beijing maintains his decision. In the whole, the rates would go to about 115 percent, according to Su Yue, the main economist for China at Economist Intelligence Unit. "In addition, all the conversations with China about the meetings they asked for us will be closed," Trump threatened. Wang explained that although Chinese exporters are now facing the new reality of a permanent increase in export costs, this does not mean that exports will stop. On the contrary, it forces exporters to find new markets and reduce the shipping of goods directly to the US. Alicia Garcia-Herrero, chief economist for the Asia Pacific region of the French investment bank Natixis, also minimized Trump's last threat. "The US market is already closed to Chinese products, at least directly from China to the US, so [an additional 50 percent increase in tariffs] is not a [effective] threat," he said. The decision reflects the fact that the US was aiming at China more than any other country, which "already happened before China retaliated," he said. Errors and blackmail China threatened yesterday "to resolutely be contracted to safeguard its own rights and interests," in response to Trump's threat. In a statement, the Ministry of Commerce said the US imposition of the "so -called" reciprocal tariffs "to China is" completely unfounded and is a typical unilateral "bullying" practice. "The countermeasures taken by China aim to safeguard their sovereignty, security and development interests and maintain the normal order of international trade. They are completely legitimate," read in the statement. "The US threat of increasing rates on China is a mistake on a mistake and once again exposes the blackmailer of the US. China will never accept it. If the US insists on this path, China will fight to the end," he said.

item.title: Álvaro Barbosa, vice-rector of the University of São José: “Student visa is very limiting”
item.description:
The University of São José continues the negotiation saga with the Chinese authorities to recruit students from the interior of China. Vice-rector Álvaro Barbosa expects, soon, the increase in master's students from 30 to 200. Regarding the internationalization of higher education, the official advocates changes in student visas to facilitate recruitment
Does the recruitment of students from the interior of China remain a matter pending to the University of Saint Joseph? It is a process that is underway. We have had huge support from the Macao government in negotiations to obtain the quota for our university, and they have been tireless in the effort to try to resolve the issues raised by the central government. Many of the questions are legitimate and concern concerns that arise. We were granted a temporary quota of 30 students for masters ago over a probative period, which served to evaluate how we, as Western University, would host students from China. From China, there is this concern with the host of students in Macau. I think we have made a huge effort and the students who are there, included in this contingent, are quite satisfied. Is this quota for masters just? Yes. For a degree we do not have authorization yet. In this way, we are currently at the time we try to overcome this probative period in order to obtain a quota of about 200 students for masters. We are in the final phase of the evaluation process and everything has been doing well. We will have the possibility that, next academic year, expand this quota. That would be great, because for our university, to have a greater impact of our mission in Macao, it is essential to have access to students from mainland China. We cannot be a university in an integrated region in a country like China, and not contact with students from China. Is it more difficult for USJ to compete with other universities, such as those of Hong Kong, by foreign students, outside China? The issue of recruitment of international students has become a priority for Macao universities. In the last two or three years, it has become evident that this internationalization is very important. What difficulty is there? There is the issue related to student visas, as these visas currently do not allow students to do any kind of work, denying them that minimum local subsistence mechanism to be able to meet expenses. Nor is it contemplated the possibility of, when the student concludes his formation, to be in the territory and find work. What all countries and regions that are competitive in higher education do, such as Singapore, Hong Kong or Australia, is to have incentive policies. Allow students to work part -time, for example. In Hong Kong when a degree ends, the student can stay in the territory up to a maximum of two years to find a job. This kind of measures do not yet exist in Macau, but I think the government is pondering this possibility. From the moment the decision was made that the internationalization of higher education was important, this must be accompanied with the corresponding measures. The current student visa is extremely limiting and does not encourage the coming to Macao to study, only allows coming. This issue was not as present as it is now, but now there is a strategic policy of internationalization. It is also a matter of survival for local universities. Yes. Perhaps there is no greater example of a catalyst for the diversification of Macau's economy than higher education. We have ten institutions, 60,000 students in about 700,000 inhabitants. This is the potential of internationalization, to foster diversification.
And also the research that comes out of higher education. The investigation, the dynamics of the work that is done. There are a number of vectors that higher education brings to a region or country, this happened to Portugal, for example, with the policy of doctoral scholarships for students from abroad, which completely changed the dynamics of higher education. Cape Verde developed thanks to the impact of higher education. Then we need to make the system more flexible in Macau. I don't know if it's a matter of having a holistic view of strategy. There may be an idea, but then it does not intervene in all the necessary dimensions to achieve a certain goal. But I am very optimistic. I believe this new student policy is a key step to be taken in Macau. The internationalization strategy followed by all these countries and regions I spoke, and were successful in capturing international students, was always the same. No need to invent much. First, one should increase the capacity and notoriety of universities, and then a policy of scholarships, which will enhance a student flow, creating a reference for the territory, so that studying there becomes a habit. After this flow of students for a few years, an image is already created and some scholarships can be removed, which students will continue to choose a particular territory to study in it. Australia has a huge higher education industry, for example, and I think that in Macau we just have to follow the same strategies. We do, at USJ, that a little. How, in concrete terms? We offer many scholarships, and in this sense the Diocese of Macao has helped us build this flow of international students that allow us to create this dynamic that we hope will be sustainable by itself in the future. I think the government is also doing this. There have always been scholarships in Macau, attributed mainly by the Macau Foundation, but this measure will be strengthened. Solving the student's visa issue, creating a scholarship incentive system for five to ten years, Macau will have a bright future as an international higher education destination. But we need to invest, continue, and it takes a few years. USJ created the “Macau Hub” platform, in partnership with the Macau Scientific and Cultural Center (CCCM) in 2023. At what stage is this project? This project has to do with our interest in developing a relationship dynamic of Lusophone countries centered in Lisbon in the area of ​​entrepreneurship, first. This cabinet we have at CCCM is not intended to offer training in Portugal, but we want to do something else. As we are positioned in the Great Bay and with Hengqin, where it is intended to activate a business ecosystem, we want to take advantage of the fact that we have relations with the Lusophone world to activate the access of the startups of Portugal, Brazil and Angola, above all, to the great bay and hengqin. We are trying to create a kind of incubator of transnational companies, in which we support the development of Lusophone businesses that want to settle in the large bay and also the reverse system. Strategically, for a university, it is absolutely fundamental to have a dynamic in the area of ​​entrepreneurship. Currently, more than half of our students do not want to go to the corporate world, but create their own businesses. Just as universities have to have employability solutions, they also have to have them for entrepreneurs, who are increasingly. So a university has to have a business incubator. My vision of the future for higher education goes around: a university, besides having a library and canteen, will also have its own business incubator. I would say that most students of management or economy courses dream of having their own business, especially in China. China is perhaps one of the most entrepreneurial countries in the world. The CCCM welcomes this initiative in Portugal, but we also work with the Portuguese Catholic University. And concrete results, already have it? We have a number of small initial projects that are starting now, and we also work with many business organizations. We have now negotiated a series of projects, and I think everything will develop very quickly, based on the manifestations of interest we have. We were in Angola in December and we have already aligned a series of initiatives, we also have projects with Brazil and Portugal.

item.title: Adelina Moura, teacher and trainer: “The mobile phone is like a Swiss knife”
